# Council of Ministers <orig>مجلس الوزراء</orig>
## Decree No. 91 of 2025
### Regarding the Appointment of the Director of His Highness the Amir's Office

- Having reviewed the Constitution,
- And Amiri Order <orig>الأمر الأميري</orig> issued on 2 Dhu al-Qa'dah 1445 AH, corresponding to 10 May 2024 AD,
- And Law No. 29 of 1962 regarding Amiri Diwan <orig>الديوان الأميري</orig> employees, amended by Decree-Law No. 5 of 1978,
- And Decree-Law No. 15 of 1979 regarding Civil Service <orig>الخدمة المدنية</orig>, and its amending laws,
- And the Decree issued on 7 Jumada al-Ula 1399 AH, corresponding to 4 April 1979 AD, regarding the Civil Service System <orig>نظام الخدمة المدنية</orig>, and its amending decrees,
- And based on the submission of the Prime Minister <orig>رئيس مجلس الوزراء</orig>,
- And after the approval of the Council of Ministers <orig>مجلس الوزراء</orig>,

We have decreed the following:

### Article One
Retired Lieutenant General / Jamal Mohammed Al-Dhiyab <orig>جمال محمد الذياب</orig> shall be appointed as Director of His Highness the Amir's Office <orig>مكتب حضرة صاحب السمو الأمير</orig> - with the Excellent Grade.

### Article Two
The Prime Minister <orig>رئيس مجلس الوزراء</orig> and the Ministers <orig>الوزراء</orig> - each within their respective competencies - shall implement this Decree, which shall be effective from the date of its issuance and published in the Official Gazette <orig>الجريدة الرسمية</orig>.

## Decree No. 94 of 2025
Regarding the transfer of an Advisor from the Bureau of His Highness the Crown Prince <orig>ديوان سمو ولي العهد</orig>
to the Amiri Diwan <orig>الديوان الأميري</orig> and the renewal of his appointment

- Having reviewed the Constitution,
- And Amiri Order issued on 2 Dhu al-Qi'dah 1445 AH corresponding to 10 May 2024 AD,
- And Law No. 29 of 1962 regarding Amiri Diwan <orig>الديوان الأميري</orig> employees, amended by Decree-Law No. 5 of 1978,
- And Decree-Law No. 15 of 1979 regarding Civil Service <orig>الخدمة المدنية</orig>, and its amending laws,
- And Decree-Law No. 48 of 1979 regarding the determination of salaries for the Prime Minister and Ministers,
- And the Decree issued on 7 Jumada al-Ula 1399 AH corresponding to 4 April 1979 AD regarding the Civil Service System <orig>نظام الخدمة المدنية</orig>, and its amending decrees,
- And Decree No. 82 of 2021 appointing an Advisor with the rank of Minister in the Bureau of His Highness the Crown Prince <orig>ديوان سمو ولي العهد</orig>,
- And based on the submission of the Prime Minister,
- And after the approval of the Council of Ministers <orig>مجلس الوزراء</orig>,

We have decreed the following:
### Article One
Mr. Dhari Abdullah Al-Othman <orig>ضاري عبد الله العثمان</orig> – Advisor at the Bureau of His Highness the Crown Prince <orig>ديوان سمو ولي العهد</orig> – shall be transferred to the Amiri Diwan <orig>الديوان الأميري</orig>, and his appointment shall be renewed with the rank of Minister for a period of four years, effective from 2025/4/6.

### Article Two
The Prime Minister and the Ministers – each within their respective competencies – shall implement this Decree, which shall be effective from the date of its issuance and published in the Official Gazette.

Amir of Kuwait
Mishal Al-Ahmad Al-Jaber Al-Sabah <orig>مشعل الأحمد الجابر الصباح</orig>

Prime Minister
Ahmed Abdullah Al-Ahmad Al-Sabah <orig>أحمد عبد الله الأحمد الصباح</orig>

# Decree No. 96 of 2025
**On the Transfer of a Senior Official from the Bureau of His Highness the Crown Prince to the Amiri Diwan**

- Having reviewed the Constitution <orig>الدستور</orig>,
- And Amiri Order <orig>الأمر الأميري</orig> issued on 2 Dhu al-Qi'dah 1445 AH corresponding to 10 May 2024 AD,
- And Law No. 29 of 1962 regarding Amiri Diwan <orig>الديوان الأميري</orig> employees, amended by Decree-Law No. 5 of 1978,
- And Decree-Law No. 15 of 1979 regarding Civil Service <orig>الخدمة المدنية</orig>, and its amending laws,
- And the Decree issued on 7 Jumada al-Ula 1399 AH corresponding to 4 April 1979 AD regarding the Civil Service System <orig>نظام الخدمة المدنية</orig>, and its amending decrees,
- And Decree No. 116 of 2022 renewing the appointment of a senior official at the Bureau of His Highness the Crown Prince <orig>ديوان سمو ولي العهد</orig>,
- And based on the submission of the Prime Minister <orig>رئيس مجلس الوزراء</orig>,
- And after the approval of the Council of Ministers <orig>مجلس الوزراء</orig>,
We have decreed the following:

## Article One
Mr. Mazen Issa Abdul Rahman Al-Issa <orig>مازن عيسى عبد الرحمن العيسى</orig> shall be transferred from the Bureau of His Highness the Crown Prince <orig>ديوان سمو ولي العهد</orig> to the Amiri Diwan <orig>الديوان الأميري</orig> – with the same excellent job grade <orig>الدرجة الوظيفية (الممتازة)</orig> – and for the remaining period of his renewed appointment.

## Article Two
The Prime Minister <orig>رئيس مجلس الوزراء</orig> and the Ministers <orig>الوزراء</orig> – each within their respective competencies – shall implement this Decree, which shall be effective from the date of its publication and published in the Official Gazette <orig>الجريدة الرسمية</orig>.

  "document_date": "2025-05-28",
  "issue_number": 1741,
  "volume_number": 71,
  "document_type": "official_gazette",
  "languages_detected": ["ar"],
  "page_type": "content",
  "authors": "Essam Salem Al-Roumi <orig>عصام سالم الرومي</orig>",
  "publisher": "Kuwait Today / Al-Kuwait Al-Youm <orig>الكويت اليوم</orig>",
  "page_summary": "This page contains Resolution No. (143) of 2025 from the State Audit Bureau, outlining the duties and performance controls for agents managing seized funds and assets, referencing various laws and a Public Prosecutor's decision on money laundering."
}
</page_metadata>
<header>
6
Kuwait Today / Al-Kuwait Al-Youm <orig>الكويت اليوم</orig> Issue 1741, Seventy-First Year
Sunday, 5 Dhu al-Hijjah 1446 AH - 2025/6/1 AD
</header>
1. The agent <orig>الوكيل</orig> shall, in performing his task, adhere to all obligations of an agent <orig>الوكيل</orig> in accordance with the provisions of Chapter Two of Part Three of Book Two of the aforementioned Decree-Law No. (67) of 1980, provided that this does not conflict with the provisions stipulated in this decision or with any future decisions issued by the President of the State Audit Bureau <orig>رئيس ديوان المحاسبة</orig>.
2. The agent <orig>الوكيل</orig> shall be committed to preserving the funds mentioned in the aforementioned item and entrusted to his management. He must exercise the diligence of an ordinary person and what the provisions of the aforementioned agency <orig>الوكالة</orig> require.
3. The agent <orig>الوكيل</orig> may not delegate all or part of his task to anyone except with written permission from the Public Prosecutor <orig>النائب العام</orig>.
4. The agent's <orig>الوكيل</orig> authority is limited to acts of administration. He may not undertake any disposition that is not an act of administration, even if necessity requires it with a statement of reasons, except with written permission from the Public Prosecutor <orig>النائب العام</orig>.
5. The agent <orig>الوكيل</orig> may not use the seized funds <orig>الأموال المتحفظ عليها</orig> mentioned above
6. for his own benefit, and he is prohibited from dealing with persons whose funds have been seized.
7. The agent <orig>الوكيل</orig> must refer to the Public Prosecutor <orig>النائب العام</orig>, as appropriate, regarding all requests or grievances presented to him concerning the aforementioned seized funds <orig>الأموال المتحفظ عليها</orig> whose disposition has been prohibited.
8. The agent <orig>الوكيل</orig> must disclose any conflicts of interest between himself and the aforementioned seized funds <orig>الأموال المتحفظ عليها</orig>, as well as between himself and the persons whose funds have been seized.
9. The agent <orig>الوكيل</orig> must submit to the Public Prosecutor <orig>النائب العام</orig> every three months a report on the tasks assigned to him, including the financial position and its supplementary explanations, a statement of revenues and expenditures for the period covered by the statement, a consolidated statement thereof since taking over management until the end of this period, a cash flow statement, and a comprehensive administrative report on the dispositions related to the management of the aforementioned seized funds <orig>الأموال المتحفظ عليها</orig>. A copy of the foregoing shall be submitted to the President of the State Audit Bureau <orig>رئيس ديوان المحاسبة</orig> within fifteen days following the end of each period, and the Bureau <orig>الديوان</orig> shall notify the Public Prosecutor <orig>النائب العام</orig> and the agent <orig>الوكيل</orig> of any observations it deems appropriate.
10. The agent <orig>الوكيل</orig> shall continue his management duties until the case is decided or a decision is issued to lift the seizure on the aforementioned seized funds <orig>الأموال المتحفظ عليها</orig>.
11. If the agent <orig>الوكيل</orig> wishes to terminate his agency <orig>وكالته</orig> or if it terminates for any reason, he must complete the tasks he has started in a manner that does not risk harm to the funds managed by him.

### Article Two
The President of the State Audit Bureau <orig>رئيس ديوان المحاسبة</orig> may issue a decision containing special additional controls for the performance of some agents <orig>الوكلاء</orig> in cases of seizure that necessitate such controls, according to the requirements of the interest of the funds under management.

### Article Three
This decision shall be published in the Official Gazette <orig>الجريدة الرسمية</orig> and shall come into force on the day following its publication date. All concerned parties shall implement it, each within their respective jurisdiction.

## Resolution
### Article One
The following text shall be added to the definitions contained in Article One of Ministerial Resolution No. (152) of 2023, referred to above:
- Units Subject to Central Bank <orig>البنك المركزي</orig> Supervision:
1- Local Banks (Kuwaiti banks and branches of foreign banks licensed to operate within the State of Kuwait <orig>دولة الكويت</orig> by the Central Bank <orig>البنك المركزي</orig>)
2- Finance companies established in accordance with Ministerial Resolution No. (38) of 2011 regarding the regulation of Central Bank <orig>البنك المركزي</orig> supervision over finance companies.
3- Investment companies with regard to the financing activity undertaken by these companies.

### Article Two
The texts of Articles (18) and (22) and item No. (7) of Annex No. (2) of Ministerial Resolution No. (152) of 2023, referred to above, shall be replaced with the following texts: -

**Article (18)**
"New appraisers shall comply with this Resolution from its date of issuance. All appraisers listed in the real estate appraisers' register at the time of issuance of this Resolution shall be registered under the classification of real estate appraiser (A), and they shall comply with adjusting their status in accordance with the provisions of this Resolution until 2027/12/31. Anyone who fails to do so shall be considered a real estate appraiser with classification (C) in the appraisers' register at the Ministry of Commerce and Industry <orig>وزارة التجارة والصناعة</orig>."

**Article (22)**
"The real estate appraiser must adhere to the unified real estate appraisal form specified in Annex No. (3) of this Resolution. The appraisal service provider must submit the unified real estate appraisal form to the administration for all properties they have appraised within (60) days from the issuance of the appraisal.
Item No. (7) of Annex No. (2)
"Units subject to Central Bank <orig>البنك المركزي</orig> supervision must comply with its instructions regarding the appraisal of real estate assets."

### Article Three
All officials – each within their respective jurisdiction – shall implement this Resolution, which shall be effective from its date of issuance and published in the Official Gazette <orig>الجريدة الرسمية</orig>.

Minister of Commerce and Industry <orig>وزير التجارة والصناعة</orig>
Khalifa Abdullah Al-Ajeel <orig>خليفة عبد الله العجيل</orig>

- After reviewing the Constitution.
- And on the Amiri Order <orig>الأمر الأميري</orig> issued on 2 Dhu al-Qi'dah 1445 AH corresponding to 10 May 2024 AD.
- And on the Law Regulating the Licensing of Fundraising for Public Purposes <orig>قانون تنظيم الترخيص بجمع المال للأغراض العامة</orig>, effective from 1/3/1959.
- And on the Penal Code <orig>قانون الجزاء</orig> issued by Law No. 16 of 1960, and its amending laws.
- And on the Code of Criminal Procedures and Trials <orig>قانون الإجراءات والمحاكمات الجزائية</orig> issued by Law No. 17 of 1960, and its amending laws.
- And on Law No. 24 of 1962 regarding Clubs and Public Benefit Associations <orig>الأندية وجمعيات النفع العام</orig>, and its amending laws.
- And on Decree-Law No. (15) of 1979 regarding Civil Service <orig>الخدمة المدنية</orig>.
- And on the Civil Code <orig>القانون المدني</orig> issued by Decree-Law No. 67 of 1980, and its amending laws.
- And on Decree-Law No. (20) of 1981 establishing a Department within the General Court <orig>المحكمة الكلية</orig> to hear Administrative Disputes <orig>المنازعات الإدارية</orig> and its amendments.
- And on Law No. 6 of 2010 regarding Labor in the Private Sector <orig>القطاع الأهلي</orig>, and its amending laws.
- And on Law No. 125 of 2019 regarding Insurance Regulation <orig>تنظيم التأمين</orig>.
- And on Law No. 12 of 2020 regarding the Right to Access Information <orig>حق الاطلاع على المعلومات</orig>.
- And on Decree-Law No. (49) of 2024 issuing the Unified System (Law) for Volunteer Work <orig>النظام (القانون) الموحد للعمل التطوعي</orig> in the Gulf Cooperation Council <orig>مجلس التعاون لدول الخليج العربية</orig> (GCC) States.
- And on the Decree issued on 4/4/1979 regarding the Civil Service System <orig>نظام الخدمة المدنية</orig> and its amendments.
- And on Decree (50) of 2017 regarding the Ministry of Social Affairs <orig>وزارة الشؤون الاجتماعية</orig>.
- And on the resolution of the Supreme Council of the Gulf Cooperation Council <orig>المجلس الأعلى لمجلس التعاون لدول الخليج العربية</orig> (GCC) adopted at its forty-fourth session held in Doha – State of Qatar – on 21 Jumada al-Ula 1445 AH corresponding to 5 December 2023, approving the Unified System (Law) for Volunteer Work <orig>النظام ( القانون ) العمل التطوعي الموحد</orig> in the GCC States.
- And on Cabinet Resolution No. (1093) regarding the approval of designating the Ministry of Social Affairs <orig>وزارة الشؤون الاجتماعية</orig> as the concerned Ministry and identifying His Excellency the Minister of Social Affairs and Family and Childhood Affairs <orig>وزير الشؤون الاجتماعية وشؤون الأسرة والطفولة</orig> as the competent Minister for implementing Decree-Law No. (49) of 2024 issuing the Unified (Law) for Volunteer Work <orig>القانون الموحد للعمل التطوعي</orig> in the GCC States.
- And on Ministerial Resolution No. (20/A) of 2016 issuing the Executive Regulations <orig>اللائحة التنفيذية</orig> for Law No. (80) of 2015 regarding Family Foster Care <orig>الحضانة العائلية</orig>.
- And after the submission by Mr. / Undersecretary of the Ministry <orig>وكيل الوزارة</orig>.
- And based on what the public interest <orig>المصلحة العامة</orig> dictates.

### Has Decided
**Article One:** Volunteer teams registered with the Ministry of Social Affairs <orig>وزارة الشؤون الاجتماعية</orig> shall be subject to the provisions of the regulations attached to this resolution.
**Article Two:** Ministerial Resolution No. (20/A) of 2016 issuing the Executive Regulations <orig>اللائحة التنفيذية</orig> for Law No. (80) of 2015 regarding Family Foster Care <orig>الحضانة العائلية</orig> shall remain in effect.
**Article Three:** Any text that contradicts the provisions of this resolution and its accompanying regulations shall be repealed.
**Article Four:** The provisions of this resolution shall be effective from the date of its publication in the Official Gazette <orig>الجريدة الرسمية</orig>, and the competent authorities <orig>جهات الاختصاص</orig> shall be informed and implement its contents.

Minister of Social Affairs and Family and Childhood Affairs <orig>وزير الشؤون الاجتماعية وشؤون الأسرة والطفولة</orig>
Dr. Amthal Hadi Hayef Al-Huwaila <orig>د. أمثال هادي هايف الحويلة</orig>

Issued on: 23 Dhu al-Qi'dah 1446 AH
Corresponding to: 21 May 2025 AD

# Chapter One
## "General Provisions"
### Article (1)
For the purpose of applying these regulations, the terms mentioned below shall have the meaning indicated next to each of them: –
- **The Ministry:** The Ministry of Social Affairs <orig>وزارة الشؤون الاجتماعية</orig>.
- **The Minister:** The Minister of Social Affairs and Family and Childhood Affairs <orig>وزير الشؤون الاجتماعية وشؤون الأسرة والطفولة</orig>.
- **The Competent Undersecretary:** The Assistant Undersecretary for Social Development <orig>الوكيل المساعد للتنمية الاجتماعية</orig>.
- **The Committee:** The Permanent Committee for Supervising Volunteer Work <orig>اللجنة الدائمة للإشراف على العمل التطوعي</orig>.
- **The Competent Department:** The Community Development Department <orig>إدارة تنمية المجتمع</orig>.
- **Volunteer Work:** Any activity, effort, work, time, or skill provided by a natural or legal person without requiring or aiming to achieve a material return.
- **The Volunteered-for Entity:** The entity that organizes volunteer work in accordance with the System (Law).

Volunteer: Any natural or legal person who performs voluntary work.
Voluntary Team: A group of volunteers who perform voluntary work to achieve common and specific goals.
Administrative Body: Some members of the voluntary team, not less than 21 years of age, who manage the team's affairs, conduct its business, and do everything necessary to achieve its objectives.
Sponsorships: Logistic support or in-kind grants provided to the voluntary team for use in voluntary work, without becoming part of the financial liability of any individual member of the voluntary team.
Register: A record in which the names of volunteers and their specializations – if any – voluntary teams, voluntary programs and activities, the entity for which volunteering is performed, and data and information related to voluntary work are recorded.

### Article (2)
The Ministry <orig>الوزارة</orig> seeks to organize, develop, disseminate, and encourage the culture of voluntary work, attract volunteers to participate in voluntary activities, and facilitate the work of voluntary teams aimed at providing service and development to the community, in order to enhance the spirit of initiative and positive participation, and to guide and strengthen the role of individuals and institutions in voluntary work to achieve the public good.

### Article (3)
It is prohibited to establish voluntary teams, perform voluntary work, or organize it except after obtaining a license from the competent department.

## Chapter Two
### The Competent Department
### Article (4)
The competent department undertakes the following tasks to regulate voluntary work:
- Proposing general rules regulating voluntary work.
- Receiving license applications related to voluntary work.
- Monitoring the register for the registration of voluntary teams and ensuring the receipt and registration of applications.
- Supervising and overseeing voluntary work and submitting recommendations and reports to the Committee.
- Conducting research and studies and issuing specialized publications in the field of voluntary work.
- Organizing conferences and events related to voluntary work.
- Receiving complaints and grievances related to voluntary work.
- Periodic evaluation and classification of voluntary teams.
- Studying the status of voluntary teams and submitting them to the Committee for cancellation of their registration.

## Chapter Three
### Voluntary Work Committee
### Article (5)
The Permanent Committee <orig>اللجنة الدائمة</orig> shall be formed by a decision of the Undersecretary of the Ministry <orig>وكيل الوزارة</orig> to oversee voluntary work.
- Establishing general rules regulating voluntary work.
- Issuing licenses related to voluntary work.
- Supervising and overseeing voluntary work.
- Approving or rejecting the registration of voluntary teams.
- Considering and deciding on grievances submitted by voluntary teams.
- Conducting investigations into complaints filed by or against voluntary teams.
- Cancelling the registration of a voluntary team after its status has been reviewed by the competent department.
- Determining voluntary activities that require insurance for volunteers.
- Organizing the provision of incentives to honor pioneering voluntary work.

## Chapter Four
### Establishment of Voluntary Teams
### Article (6)
The following conditions are required for the establishment of a voluntary team:
- The voluntary team must have a written work document signed by all founders.
- The number of founders must not be less than five members.
- All founding members must be of Kuwaiti nationality.
- None of the founding members must have been previously convicted of a felony or a freedom-restricting penalty for a crime involving moral turpitude or breach of trust, unless their rehabilitation has been restored.
- Submission of criminal records for founding members and obtaining the approval of the Ministry of Interior <orig>وزارة الداخلية</orig>.
- The purpose of the voluntary team must be to provide a service aimed at achieving the public good and benefiting society, whether inside or outside the State of Kuwait <orig>دولة الكويت</orig>.
- The age of the founding members must not be less than 21 years.
- All required conditions for establishing the team must be met by the representative of the legal person.

### Article (7)
The voluntary team's work document must include the following data:
- Name of the voluntary team.
- Team's activity and field of activity.
- Team's mission, vision, and objectives.

The team must obtain the approval of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs <orig>وزارة الخارجية</orig> if the activity extends outside the State of Kuwait <orig>دولة الكويت</orig>, provided that it is under the umbrella of a public benefit association <orig>جمعية النفع العام</orig> and the Ministry <orig>الوزارة</orig> is notified accordingly.

## Chapter Five
### Administrative Body
### Article (12)
The team is managed by an administrative body <orig>هيئة إدارية</orig> specialized in the following:
- Managing the team's affairs, conducting its business, and providing various means for members to practice their voluntary activity to the fullest.
- Establishing foundations and programs that help the team achieve its objectives.
- Reviewing membership applications.
- Receiving complaints submitted by or against team members and forwarding them to the committee <orig>اللجنة</orig>.
- Establishing regulations to organize the team's affairs from administrative, technical, and financial aspects, and issuing relevant instructions and decisions.
- Forming committees <orig>لجان</orig> to organize the team's affairs.
- Providing the competent department <orig>الإدارة المختصة</orig> with a report on each team activity within a period not exceeding (15) days from the date of the activity's completion.
- Determining the dates for holding the annual general meeting <orig>الاجتماع السنوي العام</orig> and implementing its decisions.
- Preparing the annual report of the team's activities and presenting it to the annual general meeting <orig>الاجتماع السنوي العام</orig> after obtaining the committee's <orig>اللجنة</orig> approval.
- Preparing the final account for the ended fiscal year and drafting the estimated budget project in preparation for presenting it to the auditor <orig>مراقب الحسابات</orig> and the annual general meeting <orig>الاجتماع السنوي العام</orig>.
- Discussing proposals submitted by members.
- Receiving applications from those interested in volunteer work.
- Attracting those interested in volunteer work to participate in the voluntary activities it organizes according to the controls determined by the committee <orig>اللجنة</orig>.
- Not involving any volunteer in volunteer work until they are registered in the record.
- Training volunteers, enhancing their capabilities in their field of specialization, monitoring volunteers' performance, evaluating them, and motivating them.
- Granting the volunteer, after performing volunteer work, a certificate for the work accomplished and the number of hours.
- Maintaining the confidentiality of information and data related to the volunteer and the volunteer team.
- Ensuring that the tasks assigned to the volunteer are appropriate for their qualifications, intellectual, and physical abilities.
- The address of the headquarters adopted as its administrative center, if any.
- Names, ages, and professions of the founding members.
- Membership conditions, types, and the rights and duties of members.
- How to select members of the administrative body <orig>الهيئة الإدارية</orig> and methods for their dismissal or termination of membership.
- The mechanism for holding administrative body <orig>الهيئة الإدارية</orig> meetings and the validity of its decisions.
- Rules for amending the volunteer team's work document and circumstances of its dissolution.
- The approved email address for the team through which they are corresponded with.
- Previous achievements of the team, if any.
- The future plan of the volunteer team.

### Article (8)
The application for registration of the volunteer team <orig>الفريق التطوعي</orig> shall be submitted to the competent department <orig>الإدارة المختصة</orig>, accompanied by the following documents:
- Two copies of the work document signed by all founding members.
- Names of the founding members and their representatives.
- Names of the members of the volunteer team's administrative body <orig>الهيئة الإدارية</orig> and their election method.
- Criminal record <orig>الصحيفة الجنائية</orig> of the founding members.
- Copies of valid civil IDs <orig>البطاقة المدنية</orig> for the founding members.
- A pledge signed by the founders to abide by the relevant decisions and regulations issued by the Ministry <orig>الوزارة</orig> and to officially notify the Ministry <orig>الوزارة</orig> of any change in data within a period not exceeding two weeks from the date of change.
The date of submission of the application shall be recorded on a copy delivered to the applicant, along with its registration in the special register <orig>السجل الخاص</orig> at the competent department <orig>الإدارة المختصة</orig>.

### Article (9)
The competent department <orig>الإدارة المختصة</orig> shall examine the team registration application and decide on it within a period not exceeding (30) days from the date of its submission, provided it meets the conditions stipulated in these regulations and the decisions organizing volunteer teams, and refer it to the competent committee <orig>اللجنة المختصة</orig>. In case of rejection, the reasons for rejection must be stated, and the representative of the founders shall be notified. If the period expires without a response, the application shall be considered rejected. Applicants have the right to appeal the rejection decision within (30) days by means of a letter addressed to the competent Undersecretary <orig>الوكيل المختص</orig>.
The Ministry <orig>الوزارة</orig> shall issue a volunteer team <orig>الفريق التطوعي</orig> registration certificate <orig>شهادة تسجيل</orig> indicating the team's registration, its purposes, and the names of the administrative body <orig>الهيئة الإدارية</orig> members, valid for one year from the date of issue. It shall be renewed based on a decision from the committee <orig>اللجنة</orig>, provided that the team's previous achievements and a future work plan are submitted for certificate renewal.

### Article (10)
The team is obligated to register its new members and notify the Ministry <orig>الوزارة</orig> of their names, civil ID numbers <orig>أرقامهم المدنية</orig>, and specializations.

### Article (11)
The volunteer team <orig>الفريق التطوعي</orig> may work with any public benefit associations <orig>جمعيات أو مؤسسات النفع العام</orig> or institutions whose activities align with its objectives, after obtaining the committee's <orig>اللجنة</orig> approval.

## Article (13)
The Administrative Body shall select from among its members those who will hold the following positions:
- Head of the Volunteer Team.
- Deputy Head of the Volunteer Team.
- Secretary.
- Treasurer.
It is not permissible to combine membership in the Administrative Body of more than one volunteer team.

## Article (14)
The Administrative Body shall manage the team, and the Head shall represent the team.
The Deputy Head shall assume the powers of the Head in their absence.

## Article (15)
For the Administrative Body meeting to be valid, more than half of its members must be present. Decisions shall be issued by the majority of the attending members. In case of a tie in votes, the side with the Head shall prevail.

## Article (16)
A member shall be considered resigned from the Administrative Body if they fail to attend its sessions without an acceptable excuse four consecutive times or five separate times during the Gregorian calendar year.

## Article (17)
If a position of one of the Administrative Body members becomes vacant for any reason, the competent department shall be notified. Another member shall be selected to fill the vacant seat by the remaining Administrative Body for the remainder of its term, in accordance with the procedures followed for selecting other Administrative Body members. The Ministry shall be notified of its decision within two weeks from the date of the change.

## Article (18)
The Administrative Body has the right to make changes among the positions of its members. The Administrative Body is obligated to notify the competent department of its decision within two weeks from the date of the change.

## Article (19)
The Head of the Volunteer Team shall exercise the following powers: -
- Presiding over the Annual General Meeting and the Administrative Body.
- Calling for the Annual General Meeting and the Administrative Body.
- Representing the team before third parties.

## Article (20)
The Secretary shall exercise the following powers: -
- Receiving incoming and outgoing correspondence and recording it in special registers.
- Maintaining the records and ledgers required for the team's work.
- Scheduling meetings in coordination with the session chairman.
- Preparing and sending invitations to team members.

## Article (21)
The Treasurer shall exercise the following powers: -
- Managing the team's financial affairs.
- Collecting and recording all revenues and documenting all in-kind grants.
- Implementing the financial decisions of the Administrative Body and verifying their compliance with budget items and the financial regulations.
- Signing disbursement vouchers with the Head or Deputy Head, as applicable.
- Safeguarding revenue and expenditure documents.
- Preparing the draft final account for the ended fiscal year and the draft estimated budget for the following fiscal year and presenting them at the Annual Meeting.
- Maintaining financial records and ledgers at the team's headquarters.
- Disbursing salaries and various purchase invoices.

Chapter Six
Financial Affairs of the Volunteer Team

## Article (22)
The financial resources of the volunteer team, after obtaining the necessary approvals, shall consist of the following: -
- Cash or in-kind gifts and donations received from individuals, Kuwaiti legal entities, institutions, associations, and Kuwaiti charitable organizations.
- Members' contributions.
- What the legal entity under whose umbrella the volunteer team operates allocates from its resources, taking into account the approved accounting restrictions in this regard.

## Article (23)
The Administrative Body of the team shall prepare an estimated budget. The fiscal year for the volunteer team shall begin on January 1st of each year and end on December 31st, with the first year being an exception.

## Article (24)
The volunteer team may, in order to achieve its objectives and support its financial resources, obtain sponsorships and organize service projects, exhibitions, and recreational activities, provided that the Ministry is notified 30 days prior to the activity. All revenues generated from the activity, after being approved by the Treasurer and the Head of the team, shall be recorded in the designated ledgers. These revenues shall be realized in a manner that achieves the objectives and purposes of the volunteer team. It is required to obtain the Ministry's approval after coordination with the Ministry of Foreign Affairs <orig>وزارة الخارجية</orig> before accepting sponsorships from outside the State of Kuwait <orig>دولة الكويت</orig>. The volunteer team must notify the Ministry of all amounts it receives within ten days.

## Article (25)
The volunteer team may, after notifying the Ministry, coordinate with registered charitable societies to contribute to fundraising, provided that this is done through the charitable society's bank account and with its written approval. A certificate must be issued by the charitable society to the volunteer team stating the prohibition of cash donations.

### Article (26)
Every member of the volunteer team has the right to submit a request to the head to access the volunteer team's financial and administrative records.
### Article (27)
The administrative body of each team shall prepare an annual budget detailing the team's resources, expenditures, and areas of spending, including sponsorships and their sources.
If the team's revenues exceed ten thousand Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig>, the budget and final accounts shall be submitted to an accredited auditor for examination and a report thereon shall be presented to the Annual General Meeting.
### Article (28)
The volunteer team and the entity for which it volunteers are obligated to submit a report on the expenditures made for the sponsorships provided to the team to the competent department.
### Article (29)
The association under whose umbrella the volunteer team operates may allocate a bank account for the team's benefit in one of the local banks, and the account shall be opened in the name of the association.
### Article (30)
The volunteer team is prohibited from spending funds for purposes other than those for which it was established.
### Article (31)
The entity for which volunteers work is prohibited from obtaining direct or indirect financial returns from the efforts of the volunteers.
## Chapter Seven
Annual General Meeting of the Volunteer Team
### Article (32)
The volunteer team shall hold an Annual General Meeting of registered members whose membership in the team has lasted for six months prior to the date of the meeting.
### Article (33)
The Annual General Meeting shall be convened by invitation from the team leader within a period not exceeding two months from the end of the financial year. The invitation shall be sent in writing or electronically to the members at least two weeks before the scheduled date of the meeting, and the following attachments shall be sent with the invitation:-
- Session agenda.
- Detailed report on the volunteer team's activities.
- The budget and final accounts for the ended financial year, approved by the auditor if the team's revenues exceed ten thousand Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig>.
- Draft estimated budget for the team.
- Proposals submitted by members for presentation to the volunteer team.
### Article (34)
The Annual General Meeting is responsible for considering:
- Approval of the financial and administrative reports of the administrative body.
- Approval of the final accounts for the ended financial year.
- Discussion of all proposals submitted by members within the specified deadlines.
- Selection of the auditor and determination of their remuneration if the team's revenues exceed ten thousand Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig>.
- Discharge of the administrative body members.
- Amendment of the volunteer team's work document and the competencies contained therein.
### Article (35)
The Annual General Meeting shall be valid if attended by more than half of the members entitled to attend. If the quorum is not met at the scheduled time, the meeting shall be postponed for one hour, after which the meeting shall be valid regardless of the number of members present, provided that two members of the administrative body are among them.
## Chapter Eight
Oversight and Evaluation
### Article (36)
In cases where the volunteer team or one of the administrative body members is attributed any violation of the regulations, decisions, or circulars issued by the Ministry, the committee shall investigate whether these violations have occurred. If the violation is proven by the committee, it shall submit its recommendation, and the Ministry shall impose the following penalties as it deems appropriate:-
- Warning.
- Written reprimand.
- Removal of the violation and its effects at the expense of the violator.
- Deletion of the violating member or the volunteer team.
### Article (37)
The committee may, based on the recommendation of the competent department, suspend the license for six months if (12) months have passed without any activity being carried out, provided that the violation is rectified thereafter, otherwise the committee may recommend the deletion of the team.
## Chapter Nine
Concluding Provisions
### Article (38)
A registered volunteer team may use the community development management centers in accordance with the conditions and procedures specified by the competent authority.
### Article (39)
Registered volunteer teams with the Ministry are obligated to the following:-
- Not to organize any activity through which material or in-kind donations are collected except after obtaining prior written approval from the Department of Charitable Societies and Endowments <orig>إدارة الجمعيات الخيرية والمبرات</orig> and the competent department.
- Not to organize any seminar or conference except after obtaining prior approval from the Ministry of Social Affairs <orig>وزارة الشئون الاجتماعية</orig> and the Ministry of Interior <orig>وزارة الداخلية</orig>.
- A member of the volunteer team is obligated, when organizing any activity, to display an identity card that includes the member's name and the team's name.
- The volunteer team's letter addressed to the Ministry requesting

It was decided as follows:

### Article One:
Al-Watani Investment Company <orig>شركة الوطني للاستثمار</orig> is granted approval to establish the NBK Group <orig>مجموعة بنك الكويت الوطني</orig> Multi-Asset Employee Fund, which shall be offered for private subscription with variable capital, ranging from a minimum of USD 7,000,000 (seven million US Dollars only) to a maximum of USD 1,000,000,000 (one billion US Dollars only), with a nominal value of USD 10 (ten US Dollars only) per unit. None of the unit holders may subscribe/participate in the Fund for less than the equivalent of USD 1,000 (one thousand US Dollars only), and multiples of USD 10 (ten US Dollars only).

### Article Two:
100,000,000 units (one hundred million units only), equivalent to USD 1,000,000,000 (one billion US Dollars only), shall be offered for subscription. The Fund Manager's participation in the Fund's units at establishment must not be less than KWD 100,000 (one hundred thousand Kuwaiti Dinars only) or its equivalent in other currencies as a minimum. The Fund Manager may dispose of or redeem some of the units owned by them if their net value exceeds the minimum limit stipulated in this Article.
The entities receiving subscription applications shall be:

Approval for conducting the activity, names of members and participants in conducting the activity.

### Article (40)
All correspondence issued by the Administration to the volunteer teams shall be sent to the email address of the team as recorded in the registration application.
In case of any change in the email address, the competent Administration must be notified of the new email address within a period not exceeding one week from the date of change.

### Article (41)
The volunteer team shall determine the subscription fees for its affiliated members to support its financial resources. The subscription fees and their duration shall be mentioned in the volunteer work document submitted by the team to the Ministry.

### Article (42)
The volunteer team shall grant the volunteer, after the termination of their membership for any reason, a certificate stating the period they spent registered as a member of the team.

### Article (43)
The volunteer team is prohibited from interfering in politics or religious disputes, or inciting sectarian and racial prejudices, or anything that would disrupt public order and morals.

### Article (44)
The volunteer and the volunteer team are prohibited from providing or disclosing any information to any entity or media outlet without obtaining prior permission from the entity they are volunteering for.

### Article (45)
The volunteer or the volunteer team shall adhere to the following:
- Adhering to the ethics and morals required by volunteer work.
- Abiding by the agreement concluded with the entity they are volunteering for.
- Completing volunteer work with honesty and integrity.
- Following the regulations, instructions, and controls specific to the entity they are volunteering for.
- Preserving all forms of entrusted assets and returning them to the entity they are volunteering for.
- Maintaining the confidentiality of information related to volunteer work during their service or after leaving it.
- Any other obligations requested by the Committee.

### Article (46)
Volunteer teams are not entitled to demand the provision of premises for them or to obtain financial support from the Ministry.

# Decision No. (97) of 2025
## Regarding the Renewal of Securities Activities License for Kuwait Investment Company <orig>الشركة الكويتية للاستثمار</orig>

Having reviewed:
- Law No. (7) of 2010 regarding the Establishment of the Capital Markets Authority <orig>هيئة أسواق المال</orig> and the Regulation of Securities Activities, its Executive Regulations, and amendments thereof;
- The securities activities license certificate for Kuwait Investment Company <orig>الشركة الكويتية للاستثمار</orig> No. (AP/2016/0021) issued on 2022/08/02;
- The request from Kuwait Investment Company <orig>الشركة الكويتية للاستثمار</orig> to renew its securities activities license with the Authority;
- And based on Decision No. (4) of 2025 regarding the amendment of final approval powers for the operational procedures of the Supervision Sector, issued on 2025/01/12.

It has been decided as follows:
### Article One
The securities activities license for Kuwait Investment Company <orig>الشركة الكويتية للاستثمار</orig> with the Capital Markets Authority <orig>هيئة أسواق المال</orig> is renewed to engage in the following activities:
1. Securities Broker not registered on the Securities Exchange.
2. Investment Portfolio Manager.
3. Collective Investment Scheme Manager.
4. Investment Controller.
5. Custodian.
6. Underwriting Agent.
For a period of three years, renewable, effective from 2025/08/02.

### Article Two
The competent authorities shall implement this Decision, each within its jurisdiction. It shall be effective from its date of issuance and published in the Official Gazette.

Acting Head of Supervision Sector
Anwar Jassim Al-Mudhaf <orig>أنوار جاسم المضف</orig>

Issued on: May 29, 2025 AD

- National Investment Company <orig>شركة الوطني للاستثمار</orig>.
- National Bank of Kuwait <orig>بنك الكويت الوطني</orig>.

### Article Three:
The fund's objectives are based on what is stated in the prospectus.
### Article Four:
The fund's term is fifteen years, commencing from the date of its registration in the Authority's <orig>الهيئة</orig> funds register. It is renewable for similar additional periods upon the request of the fund manager and after obtaining the approval of the Authority <orig>الهيئة</orig> and unit holders representing more than 50% of the fund's issued capital.
### Article Five:
The fund is granted a temporary license for a period of three months from the subscription start date, with the aim of completing the Authority's <orig>الهيئة</orig> requirements and the minimum capital of the fund. No fund activity may be carried out based on this temporary license.
### Article Six:
The applicant may close the subscription period and suffice with the subscribed capital at any time during the temporary license period, provided that the target group invited to subscribe is announced or notified at least three working days before the new closing date.
### Article Seven:
Should the temporary license period expire without completing the requirements stipulated in Article Five of this Decision, the temporary license shall lapse, unless the license validity is extended for another similar period, upon the request of the license applicant and before the expiry of the original temporary license period.
### Article Eight:
The prescribed fees shall be paid within thirty days from the date of issuance of this Decision. In case of failure to pay the fees within the specified period, the Decision shall be considered null and void.
### Article Nine:
The fund shall be licensed for a period of three years from the date of its registration in the Authority's <orig>الهيئة</orig> funds register, after completing the minimum capital requirement.
### Article Ten:
The competent authorities shall implement this Decision, each within its jurisdiction. It shall be effective from its date of issuance and published in the Official Gazette.

Acting Head of Supervision Sector
Anwar Jassim Al-Mudhaf <orig>أنوار جاسم المضف</orig>

Issued on: May 25, 2025 AD

School Canteens Regulation
Article (1)
For the purpose of applying the provisions of this Regulation, the following words and phrases shall have the meanings assigned to each of them:
- **Authority**: The Public Authority for Food and Nutrition <orig>الهيئة العامة للغذاء والتغذية</orig>.
- **Director General**: The Director General of the Public Authority for Food and Nutrition <orig>الهيئة العامة للغذاء والتغذية</orig>.
- **Board of Directors**: The Board of Directors of the Public Authority for Food and Nutrition <orig>الهيئة العامة للغذاء والتغذية</orig>.
- **Concerned Authorities**: The governmental bodies that overlap with the Authority regarding the necessary requirements for issuing the health licenses stipulated in this Regulation, and from which, in accordance with the legislation regulating their work, a set of requirements must be met by the license applicant according to the nature of their specialization, in addition to the conditions stipulated in this Regulation.
- **Food / Foods**: Any substance or compound, whether finished, partially processed, or unprocessed, excluding pharmaceutical preparations, intended or expected for human consumption by eating, drinking, or chewing, whether it has nutritional value or not.
- **Food Handling**: Any operation related to food, such as its production, manufacturing, preparation, processing, packaging, wrapping, equipping, or transportation.
- **Package**: Any form of packaging the product, wholly or partially, including packaging materials. The package may contain several units or types of packaging forms when presented to the consumer.
- **Label**: Any sign, logo, mark, pictorial or other descriptive statement written, printed, drawn, engraved, embossed, or explanatory/nutritional data: a descriptive explanation directed to the consumer to inform about the nutritional characteristics indicating the nutritional elements and nutritional information of a food. Nutritional explanatory data consists of two components: explanations about the nutritional element, which is the declaration of nutrients, and additional/supplementary nutritional information.
- **Nutrient List**: When using a nutritional explanation, the following data must be available: energy value, protein, total carbohydrates, fats, saturated fats, trans fats, cholesterol, sodium, total sugars, added sugar, and the amount of any substance claimed to have a nutritional or health effect.
- **Nutritional Claim**: Any statement, declaration, or hint that states, suggests, or claims that a specific food contains certain nutritional properties, including but not limited to energy value, or the food's content of protein, fats, or carbohydrates, in addition to its content of vitamins and minerals.
- **School Nutrition**: A description of the basic nutritional needs for the school-age category of children and adolescents, ensuring they receive healthy and balanced nutrition.
- **School Canteen / Canteen**: The place equipped for preparing, processing, and distributing

- Unsanitary conditions: Cases, means, and situations that can lead to food contamination with radioactive materials, filth, waste, impurities, or any foreign substances that make food harmful to human health or unfit for human consumption.
- Food spoilage: Any undesirable change, whether in taste, appearance, color, smell, or texture, that makes food unacceptable to the consumer.
- Judicial enforcement <orig>الضبطية القضائية</orig>: It is a status that grants its holder the authority to enter food establishments, take samples, conduct necessary tests, ensure the application of systems and requirements related to food safety and security, document violations, issue reports, and refer them to the Public Prosecution <orig>النيابة العامة</orig> in accordance with the procedures followed by the Authority <orig>الهيئة</orig>. In the performance of their duties, they may seek the assistance of police officers if necessary.
- Inspection form: It is a card attached to the health license of the food establishment upon its first issuance. Every inspector must document field visits to the establishment, record any new observations and procedures followed during the visit, along with the inspector's name, date of visit, and judicial enforcement <orig>الضبطية القضائية</orig> number.
- Sample: The quantity taken from a food item in a random, unbiased manner, representing the quality and characteristics of the food quantity for which a decision is to be made.
- Food handler: Any person involved in the production, transportation, packaging, storage, preparation, or sale of food items.
- Health certificate: A card issued to food handlers by the Ministry of Health <orig>وزارة الصحة</orig> after examination by the Ministry, proving their freedom from diseases and their fitness to handle food.
- Area: The space designated for handling food items to provide school nutrition services.
- Storage facility: A building or part thereof designated for keeping and storing food items.
- Permitted food items: These are the food items permitted to be served daily in the school canteen.
- Prohibited food items: These are the food items that are prohibited from being served in the school canteen.
- Nutritionally balanced meal: It is a meal that contains the four nutritional components: (protein, carbohydrates, fats, and mineral salts and vitamins), which provide the body with the appropriate amount of energy (calories) through a healthy, balanced diet.
- Means of transport: Trucks, containers, and cars, regardless of their type or size, must be prepared and equipped for transporting food items, whether at normal room temperature, refrigerated, or frozen, and must contain a device
and the prevention and provision of permitted foods within the school premises, including:
1. A canteen for displaying and selling packaged foods.
2. A canteen for preparing, cooking, and serving ready-made meals, in addition to the possibility of displaying and selling packaged foods.
3. A canteen containing a kitchen for preparing and serving hot meals or ready-made meals, in addition to the possibility of displaying and selling packaged foods.
- Food establishment(s): Any establishment where food is produced, handled, stored, prepared, distributed, or sold, whether this establishment is fixed or mobile, permanent or temporary.
- Canteen contractor: The local natural or legal person who is issued a license by the Public Authority for Food and Nutrition <orig>الهيئة العامة للغذاء والتغذية</orig> to operate the school canteen for an academic year.
- Food control: All necessary activities undertaken by the state to ensure the safety and quality of all food during production, handling, storage, preparation, distribution, sale, and possession with the intent of dealing in it, and to ensure its fitness for human consumption in order to protect consumer health and combat fraud and deception.
- Inspection: The process of examining food or food safety systems by the competent department in the Authority <orig>الهيئة</orig> with the aim of monitoring production inputs and manufacturing processes up to the final product across all stages of the food chain to verify their compliance with the requirements of approved technical regulations and standard specifications. This includes auditing documents and testing, or direct examination, sampling and analysis, or any equivalent and approved alternative measures.
- Sample: Conducting chemical, microbiological, physical, radiological, and other analyses and tests on food items to ensure their fitness for human consumption and compliance with approved specifications.
- Compliance with approved specifications: The product meets the necessary requirements under approved legislation, technical regulations, and standard specifications.
- License: A formal document issued by the competent authority authorizing the school canteen contractor to operate and engage in activity at the establishment after fulfilling the required conditions for a specified period, which must be renewed periodically.
- Health requirements: A set of health controls, conditions, and requirements that must be met in food served within the school, its preparation, preservation, and handling methods, and the requirements for workers involved, whether inside the school or in food establishments that prepare or supply it.
- GSO: Standardization Organization for the Cooperation Council for the Arab States of the Gulf <orig>هيئة التقييس لدول مجلس التعاون لدول الخليج العربية</orig>.
- Standard specifications: Non-binding documents issued by a specialized or accredited body, stipulating rules, guidelines, or characteristics for products, processes, or related production methods. They may include terms, symbols, packaging, or requirements for food labels and explanatory data related to the product or its production method.

for measuring and recording the temperature inside it, and the device's indicator must be fixed in a place that is easy to read without the need to open the vehicle door.
- Automated Self-Service Devices: Refrigerated display units for displaying, storing, and selling cold or hot food items.
- Food Allergy: An immune system reaction in the human body to certain foods or one of their components, which may cause symptoms varying in severity from mild to severe, appearing within a short period (minutes or hours) or after a long period.
- Food Allergens: Components present in food and beverages that may cause an allergic reaction.
- Foods for Special Dietary Uses: Any food prepared and offered to meet the requirements of a special diet resulting from specific natural, functional, pathological conditions, or disorders. The components of such food differ from those of ordinary foods of a similar nature and include foods prepared for lactose intolerance, wheat protein (gluten), and others.
- Cross-Contamination: The transfer of harmful substances or microorganisms to ready-to-serve food via hands, food-contact surfaces, and equipment that are dirty, or that come into contact with raw food materials and then with ready-to-serve food. It also includes contact of raw materials or their resulting liquid with ready-to-serve food.
- Pests: Any animals, insects, or organisms, including birds, flies, rodents, larvae, or any other types such as worms.
- Pest Control: The various methods used to resist or prevent all pests, insects, their secretions or parts, and to dispose of them in the correct, appropriate, and safe manner.

Article (2)
The school canteen must be operated by a canteen contractor with at least two years of prior experience in the field of food items, including their types, components, shelf life, production, preservation, transportation, and distribution, and who holds a valid health license from the Authority. For the operation of the school canteen, the contractor must obtain a license from the Authority after ensuring compliance with health requirements and technical regulations.

Article (3)
The following requirements must be met in the canteen:
1. Location:
The designated location for the canteen must be within the school fence, in a safe and easily accessible place, close to the school yard and away from restrooms, sewage, or school laboratories, and in an area not exposed to pollution. Its construction must prevent the entry of dust, water leakage, or insects.
2. Area:
The area of the canteen for displaying and selling, preparing, cooking, and serving prepared foods and ready meals must be commensurate with the student population density.
Sandwich preparation canteen (cafeteria): The total area is 100 square meters, provided that the preparation area is separate and its size is 30 – 40 square meters within the total area. In the event of a restaurant, an additional area of 100 square meters is added for every 24 students frequenting the canteen.
In the design of the kitchen for a canteen that includes a kitchen, divisions and distribution of work areas and equipment must be considered to avoid overlap, as follows: storage, preparation, cooking, and service, followed by a separate washing area to prevent cross-contamination. From a design perspective, it should be as follows:
- The kitchen area must not be less than 40 square meters.
- The storage area must not be less than 20 square meters.
- The washing area must not be less than 20 square meters.
- The dining hall area must not be less than 100 square meters for every 24 students during meal service.
3. Walls, Floors, and Ceilings:
Walls: Smooth, easy to clean, free from cracks and fissures, painted with a light-colored, oil-based, bacteria-resistant, odorless, and non-flammable paint. In preparation and washing areas, and areas where vapors or volatile oils rise, and handwashing sinks, walls must be fully covered with light-colored ceramic tiles.
Floors: Floors must be made of waterproof, non-absorbent, easy-to-clean materials that are not affected by industrial detergents or acids used in cleaning, slip-resistant, free from cracks and pits, light-colored, and easy to clean. They must be adequately sloped towards the sewage drain to allow for liquid disposal, and regular maintenance must be adhered to.
Ceilings: Smooth, easy to clean, painted with bacteria-resistant, fungi-resistant, and moisture-resistant paint. In case of water or sewage pipes, they must be isolated by installing an easily maintainable suspended ceiling, without painting the water and sewage extensions with any paint.
4. Doors, Ventilation, Windows, and Ambient Temperature:
Doors: Doors must be designed from solid, waterproof, non-absorbent materials with smooth surfaces that prevent the entry of pests and dust, and an air curtain device must be installed above the door.
Ventilation: Ventilation and lighting must be sufficient in all sections of the canteen and the dining hall, if present. Ventilation fans (extractors) must also be provided in meal preparation areas to draw out vapors and hot air, along with air conditioners to regulate temperature.
Windows: Windows must be designed to prevent the accumulation of dirt and dust, be tightly sealed, and covered with a screen to prevent the entry of pests.
Ambient Temperature: The canteen temperature must not exceed 25 degrees Celsius, and an electronic temperature indicator must be installed to measure the ambient temperature.
5. Electrical Connections: - Self-opening or foot-pedal waste bins.

- The canteen, and the dining hall if present, must be kept clean, with due regard for the use of appropriate cleaning materials.
- Provision of pest control measures licensed by the Ministry of Health <orig>وزارة الصحة</orig>.
- Provision of sufficient water from a safe and potable source equipped with a water filter.
- All water, electricity, and sewage connections must be inside the wall.
- The safety and adequacy of electrical connections for electrical appliances in the canteen must be ensured, and they must be implemented according to approved technical specifications.

### Article (4)
The food preparation and serving area within the school must be equipped and furnished as follows:
#### 1. Food Preparation Area:
- Surfaces must be made of stainless steel or marble.
- Sinks must be made of stainless steel.
- Provision of two separate washing basins or one sink divided into two basins, equipped with hot and cold water.
- Provision of appropriate cleaning tools.
- Provision of storage cabinets made of stainless steel, elevated 20 cm or more from the floor, 10 cm away from walls, smooth, easy to clean, and painted with non-flammable paint.
- The area must be equipped with metal shelves (storage cabinets), made of stainless steel or non-corrosive materials, with the lowest shelf elevated at least 20 cm from the ground.
- All food preparation tables must be made of stainless steel and easy to clean.
- Safety and security requirements such as fire extinguishers and a first-aid kit must be available.
- A trap for flying insects and reptiles, and a trap for rodents, must be available in the food preparation area.
#### 2. Food Serving Area:
- If dining and serving halls are present, they must be air-conditioned and contain a sufficient number of tables and chairs proportionate to the number of students and users, of high quality and easy to clean. The hall must be equipped with a sufficient number of handwashing sinks, provided with antiseptic hand soap and a single-use paper towel dispenser. A sufficient number of appropriately sized waste containers with tight-fitting, foot-pedal-operated lids must be available, located away from display surfaces and dining tables, with a commitment to continuous cleanliness.
- In case hot food items are served, non-corrosive thermal containers equipped with an electronic temperature indicator must be provided, ensuring they maintain the temperature

### 6. Lighting:
Lamps must be of the fixed type, not suspended by a wire, energy-efficient, non-explosive, and enclosed in a suitable protective casing. The lighting of the area must be designed by specialists to suit the space.
### 7. Water Supply:
- Water Source: The water used must be from the public water supply, if available, or from a known, hygienically safe, and potable source, equipped with a water filter.
- Water Tank: A water tank must be present, located away from sources of pollution, from which water is drawn through a network of pipes to its points of use via faucets.
### 8. Handwashing Sink:
- It is preferable for the faucet to open upwards.
- Provision of hot water.
- Provision and installation of a suitable holder for single-use paper towels.
- Provision and installation of a soap holder.
### 9. Water Drainage:
Presence of drainage openings (drains) fitted with a strainer and covered with a tight-fitting cover that opens only for cleaning and closes immediately upon completion.
### 10. Security and Safety:
- Security and safety standards and requirements approved by the competent authorities must be followed.
### 11. Sales Outlets:
- The height of the sales outlet must be appropriate for the age group, and their numbers must be commensurate with the student density, with iron barriers to help guide entry and exit from the outlet.
- They must be covered with awnings for protection from sun and rain.
- The areas surrounding the canteen must be paved.
### 12. Special Requirements:
- Provision of sufficient coolers (refrigerators) whose internal temperature does not exceed 4 degrees Celsius, equipped with a thermometer for temperature monitoring, and with a corresponding logbook on site.
- Dry foods must be stored on solid, non-corrosive (stainless steel) shelves, arranged without excessive stacking, with shelves elevated at least 20 cm from the floor and 10 cm away from walls.
- The canteen and dining hall must be provided with a sufficient number of containers

- Provide pest, insect, and rodent control methods licensed by the Ministry of Health <orig>وزارة الصحة</orig>.
- Provide sufficient water from a safe and potable source.

### 3. Preparation (Cooking) Area:
- Install an aluminum facade with a movable side door.
- Provide a fixed area with a marble countertop for the stove, covered internally and externally with porcelain, and with wall porcelain extending two meters from the floor.
- Provide a sink, proper drainage systems, and a three-branch filter.
- Install chimneys above the stoves, extending two meters above the building's roof, with filters and appropriately sized exhaust fans to draw out vapors.
- Food preparation must be carried out on the same day of serving.
- Wall heater water must not be used for preparing hot beverages and food.

### 4. Display and Sales Area:
- Install a glass facade with a movable door.
- Place one or more display refrigerators and an air conditioner to cool the area, ensuring the temperature does not exceed 25 degrees Celsius.
- Provide a water supply and proper drainage systems.
- Place display cases with thermal glass doors to preserve displayed products.
- Install insect traps.

designated for this purpose.
- Food items must be stored immediately upon receipt.
- Each food item must be stored according to its nature and in compliance with Gulf Technical Regulation No. GSO 1994:323 regarding general requirements for the transport and storage of chilled and frozen foods.
- Storage of any materials on the floors of the canteen or its associated storage rooms is prohibited.
- Storage of cleaning materials and tools next to food items is prohibited.
- Provide a trap for flying insects and reptiles, and a rodent trap in the storage area.

## Article (5)
The following requirements must be met in the storage room and storage/preservation areas:

### 1. Storage Room Conditions:
- The storage room must be separate from other material warehouses, its area must be suitable for the canteen's needs, not less than 20 square meters, and its floor and walls must be painted with a non-flammable, easy-to-clean, bacteria- and moisture-resistant paint.
- Care must be taken to ensure there are no sources of humidity inside the storage room to avoid affecting the shelf life of food items, and the storage room must be equipped with a thermometer and hygrometer.
- It must be equipped with metal shelves and storage cabinets made of stainless steel or non-corrosive materials. The lowest shelf must be at least 20 cm above the floor.

### 2. Storage and Preservation Conditions:
- Provide sufficient refrigerators with an internal temperature not exceeding 4 degrees Celsius, equipped with a thermometer for temperature monitoring, and with a corresponding logbook on site.
- Dry foods must be stored on solid, non-corrosive shelves, arranged without stacking, with shelves elevated at least 20 cm from the floor and 10 cm away from walls. The use of wood is prohibited.
- No material may be brought into the canteen before its data is recorded in the registers.

## Article (6)
Workers in the school canteen must observe health requirements, and specifically, they must observe the following:
1. A liaison officer must be designated by the school administration for daily oversight of the health requirements for canteen workers. This must be recorded in the school's daily follow-up log and presented to the inspector from the Public Authority for Food and Nutrition <orig>الهيئة العامة للغذاء والتغذية</orig> periodically or immediately if necessary.
2. Adherence to the health conditions applicable to meals during preparation, cooking, and distribution, according to instructions and regulations.
3. Obtaining a valid health certificate for food handlers in the canteen.
4. Adherence to personal hygiene for all canteen workers.
5. Adherence to wearing a clean, uniform attire during work hours, preferably white.
6. Maintaining clean and trimmed nails, and refraining from wearing rings, bracelets, and jewelry throughout the work period.
7. Any worker suffering from an infectious disease, fever, a purulent or inflamed wound, a skin rash or burn, or secretions from the eyes, nose, or ears must be suspended from work by the contractor.
8. All canteen workers must wear single-use gloves and head coverings that fully cover the hair.
9. Changing dirty or worn-out gloves when starting a new task, and after each return from outside the canteen.
10. No smoking while handling food or being present in the canteen.
11. No spitting in work areas, and no touching the nose, mouth, or ears during work.
12. The contractor and workers are prohibited from residing or staying overnight in the school canteen.
13. Hands must be washed immediately and properly at the start of work, after each food preparation or processing operation, after each break, after eating, or after touching any part of the body, after sneezing and blowing the nose, and after returning to the canteen if the worker had to leave for any reason.

At least three identical samples of food items shall be taken, and each sample shall be placed inside a sealed package with a tag containing the following data:
1. Date and time of sample collection and its number.
2. Type and quantity of the sample.
3. Address of the location from which the sample was taken.
4. Name and signature of the employee who took the sample, and the judicial enforcement <orig>الضبطية القضائية</orig> ID number.
5. Any other data for which a decision is issued by the Director General <orig>المدير العام</orig> of the Authority <orig>الهيئة</orig> or their authorized representative.
Health and technical conditions must be observed when collecting samples and transporting them to the Authority's <orig>الهيئة</orig> laboratories to determine their compliance with approved technical regulations and standard specifications and their suitability for human consumption. The competent department must maintain records documenting the food item owner's data, place of residence, and civil ID number.

## Article (8)
Food items must be transported in licensed food transport vehicles that comply with the requirements for food transport vehicles stipulated by the Authority <orig>الهيئة</orig> and in accordance with the Gulf Technical Regulation **GSO 323:1994**.
Drivers and transport workers are obligated to carry valid health certificates issued by the Ministry of Health <orig>وزارة الصحة</orig> and wear clean uniforms.
Food items shall be delivered to the school premises according to the appropriate time specified by the school administration.
Food items must be automatically packaged in plastic bags that comply with Gulf Technical Regulation No. **GSO GSO 839:2021, 1863:2021**, allow for heating, and have the product name, supplier name, production date, and expiry date printed on them by laser or on a single indelible sticker. The information must be written in Arabic, larger in size and more prominent in location, with all explanatory product data recorded on a single sticker that is not easily removable and free from scratching or striking out.
They must ensure that the supplied food items are among those permitted for circulation in school canteens.

## Article (9)
When consuming food and beverages in the school canteen, the following controls must be observed:
1. Fresh products of milk and its derivatives, sandwiches, pies and pastries, vegetables, and fruits must be supplied on their production day and are permitted for sale within their validity period, provided they are fit for human consumption and comply with approved specifications.
2. All food and beverages must comply with the healthy school nutrition standards specified by the Authority <orig>الهيئة</orig> according to the attached schedule, and disclosure must be made

## Article (7)
In the event that the canteen is proven to be non-compliant with the required health conditions, in whole or in part, the Director General <orig>المدير العام</orig> of the Authority <orig>الهيئة</orig> or their authorized representative has the right to obligate the contractor to one of the following matters, without prejudice to what is stated in Article 15 of these regulations regarding the application of penalties:
1. In case some of the required conditions are not met:
    - Re-maintenance of the canteen, if possible.
    - Relocation to another building/place that complies with the required conditions, if possible.
    - Continuation of the canteen until the end of the academic year if the matter does not harm students, food items, or their storage and presentation methods.
2. However, in case all required conditions are not met:
    - The Director General <orig>المدير العام</orig> or their authorized representative may obligate the contractor to maintain the school canteen to comply with the required conditions.
    - Relocation to another building/place that complies with the required conditions.
Employees of the Authority <orig>الهيئة</orig> holding judicial enforcement <orig>الضبطية القضائية</orig> powers, each within their jurisdiction and scope of work, have the right to inspect food transport vehicles, enter canteens, food establishments, and places subject to the provisions of these regulations and related legislation, to verify their compliance with the stipulated conditions and controls. They also have the right to request and review all ledgers, records, and documents related to food, seize suspected food items, and take samples of these food items for examination to ensure their compliance with the stipulated conditions and controls.
The competent employee must record the sample collection in a seizure report that includes the following data:
1. Date and time of the report.
2. Name, title, position, and judicial enforcement <orig>الضبطية القضائية</orig> ID number of the report editor.
3. Name, title, profession, nationality, place of residence, and civil ID number of the owner of the food item from which the samples were taken.
4. Address of the location from which the samples were taken.
5. Quantity of each sample.
6. Quantity of the goods from which the samples were taken.
7. Circumstances of sample collection, their condition, statement of trademarks, name of the food item, and all other data useful in identifying the samples and the food item.
8. The report editor shall sign the report, and the sealed samples, as detailed in the preceding paragraph, shall be attached to it. The contractor or their representative may make any statements they deem appropriate, and their statements shall be recorded in the report and they shall be asked to sign them. In case of refusal to sign, this shall be indicated in the report. The employee responsible for taking samples must temporarily seize suspected food items identified by visual inspection from which those samples were taken and deposit them based on the information recorded on them.

8. During initial preparation before cooking, all personal health requirements for workers and proper preparation practices that prevent cross-contamination or contamination of food materials by any other means must be observed.
9. During cooking, all personal health requirements for workers and cooking methods that ensure complete cooking and prevent cross-contamination or contamination of food by any other means must be observed.
10. Consideration must be given to the type of oils used in food preparation, and healthy vegetable oils must be adopted, as they do not contain saturated or hydrogenated oils, and fried foods must not be served.
11. No additional quantities of table salt should be added, and the quantities used should be reduced as much as possible, provided that it is of the iodized type.
12. Food must be cooked through a single continuous process without interruption. Partially cooking food, cooling it, and then reheating it to complete the cooking process is strictly prohibited.
13. Vegetables or fruits prepared to be served hot must be cooked to reach a temperature of 70 degrees Celsius.
14. All salads must be stored at 4 degrees Celsius immediately after preparation and until serving.
15. The school administration must identify health conditions for which certain foods may be unsuitable due to containing an allergen such as gluten, lactose, legumes, nuts, etc., so that the contractor can provide appropriate food for them. A separate area must be designated for displaying these foods, and a suitable shelf must be allocated for each type of allergen, with a label placed on the shelf in Arabic and the appropriate language for each school.
16. Food materials must not be repackaged without obtaining a repackaging license from the Authority.
17. Packaged or pre-prepared foods and beverages whose packaging has been damaged, torn, or whose data has been obscured must not be displayed, sold, or stored.

*   **Varieties**
    *   Whole milk, low-fat milk, or skim milk.
    *   Flavored milk (strawberry, banana, chocolate, vanilla).
*   **Specifications**
    *   Fresh milk or long-life milk.
    *   Added sugar content not to exceed 5% of the daily caloric value or on dried fruit.
