### 21.2 Food
#### 21.2.1 Fruits and Vegetables
*   **Varieties**
    *   Provision of fresh, ripe, high-quality seasonal fruits and vegetables.
    *   Examples of fruits: apples, bananas, pears, oranges, dates.
    *   Fruit salad without added juice.
    *   Dried fruits, excluding types boiled with sugar or other sweeteners.
    *   Examples of vegetables: cucumbers, carrots, bell peppers.
*   **Specifications**
    *   Fresh, ripe, high-quality seasonal products are to be served.
    *   To be served washed, clean, dried, and processed on the same day. Cleaning and washing of fruits and vegetables in the school canteen is prohibited.
    *   Fruit salad must not contain sugar, syrup, or any artificial sweeteners.
*   **Criteria**
    *   Average fruit piece size 100-150 g, packed in transparent, tightly sealed plastic containers.
    *   Average fruit salad size 100-150 g, packed in transparent, tightly sealed plastic containers.
    *   Average dried fruit size 25-30 g, automatically packaged without artificial colorings or preservatives, with a shelf life of no less than 6 months.
    *   Average vegetable size 30-50 g, whole or cut and packaged in transparent, tightly sealed plastic containers. A small container of low-fat labneh <orig>لبنة</orig> or yogurt <orig>روب</orig> valid for one day only is also permitted.

#### 21.2.2 Baked Goods (Breakfast and Sandwiches)
*   **Varieties**
    *   Preference for baked goods made from whole grains, brown flour, mixed flour (whole wheat flour + white flour), or gluten-free flour.
    *   Fillings of low-fat, low-salt cheeses, or low-fat labneh <orig>لبنة</orig>, or thyme, or spinach, or a mixture of more than one of these varieties are to be added.
*   **Specifications**
    *   Baked goods must be fresh.
    *   Addition of eggs or chilled and processed meats is prohibited.
    *   Addition of vegetables to sandwiches is recommended.
    *   No addition of high-fat and high-salt sauces, or mayonnaise, or butter, or butter substitutes (liquid cheese or cream).
*   **Criteria**
    *   Total weight of pastries 100 g.
    *   Sandwich weight 100 g, filling weight no less than 15 g.
    *   Packaged in plastic bags suitable for heating, with laser-printed expiry date and nutritional information label.
    *   To be supplied on the same day of production.
    *   To be delivered to the canteen from the beginning of the school day until one hour before the break starts.

#### 21.2.3 Biscuits and Wafers
*   **Varieties**
    *   Plain or with filling (peanut, date, dried fruit).
*   **Specifications**
    *   Made from brown flour, whole grains, white flour, oats, or gluten-free flour.
    *   Use of allergens such as nuts or nut butter is prohibited.
*   **Criteria**
    *   Small, automatically packaged containers. Without preservatives or artificial enhancers.
    *   Presence of nutritional information.
    *   Average size 20-25 g.
    *   Shelf life no less than 6 months at the time of sale.

### 21.5.2.1 Cupcakes
*   **Varieties**
    *   Plain, or orange, or lemon, or date, or chocolate, or vanilla.
*   **Specifications**
    *   Added sugar content not to exceed 5% of the daily caloric value or on dried fruit.
*   **Criteria**
    *   Packaged in sealed plastic bags with laser-printed expiry date.
    *   Presence of nutritional information.
    *   To be supplied on the same day of production.

### 21.2.4 Popcorn
*   **Varieties**
    *   Plain.
*   **Specifications**
    *   Low salt, without butter or any other additives.
*   **Criteria**
    *   Packaged in sealed plastic bags with laser-printed expiry date.
    *   Presence of nutritional information.
    *   Size not to exceed 20 g.
    *   Shelf life no less than 6 months at the time of sale.

### Article (13)
It is prohibited to cook, display, sell, or leave any food waste outside the school canteen or licensed and permitted sales points within the school. Full responsibility for this lies with the school principal, and a report shall be submitted to the Ministry of Education / Wizarat Al-Tarbiya <orig>وزارة التربية</orig> to take legal action.

### Article (14)
Employees of the Public Authority for Food and Nutrition / Al-Hay'a Al-'Amma Lil-Ghitha' Wal-Taghthiya <orig>الهيئة العامة للغذاء والتغذية</orig> holding judicial enforcement status, while conducting investigations and gathering information about those responsible for food activities in school canteens – licensed and unlicensed – within schools, taking samples, conducting necessary tests, and ensuring the application of systems and requirements related to food and environmental safety, shall document violations, issue reports, and refer them to the Public Prosecution / Al-Niyaba Al-'Amma <orig>النيابة العامة</orig>.
The Director General / Al-Mudeer Al-'Aam <orig>المدير العام</orig> of the Authority – or whomever he delegates – may issue an administrative decision to close violating school canteens (until the causes of the violation are removed, reconciliation procedures are completed, or a judgment is issued in the case).

### Article (15)
Without prejudice to any stricter penalty stipulated in other legislation, and taking into account the procedures mentioned in the first paragraph of Article (7) of these regulations, the canteen contractor shall be punished with a fine of no less than five hundred Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig> and no more than three thousand Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig> for anyone who violates the provisions of these regulations.
In the event that the contractor continues to not comply with the stipulated requirements, the Authority has the right to cancel the license and prohibit him from any future school canteen license.

### Article (16)
A request for reconciliation from the violator may be accepted regarding acts violating the provisions of these regulations in cases where reconciliation is permissible according to the laws and regulations of the Public Authority for Food and Nutrition / Al-Hay'a Al-'Amma Lil-Ghitha' Wal-Taghthiya <orig>الهيئة العامة للغذاء والتغذية</orig>. The report writer – after confronting the violator with the violation – shall offer reconciliation and record it in the report. The violator who wishes to reconcile must pay, within two months from the date of the reconciliation offer, the minimum fine prescribed for the attributed violation, along with correcting the violation within seven days. Reconciliation results in the dismissal of the violation or the termination of the criminal case and all its consequences. Violations for which reconciliation is not permissible according to the Authority's laws and regulations shall be referred to the Public Prosecution / Al-Niyaba Al-'Amma <orig>النيابة العامة</orig>.

- Soybeans and their products such as edamame, lecithin, and soy milk.
- Products containing eggs in their preparation or manufacturing, such as cakes and pastries.
An identification sign must be placed clearly indicating the displayed food items and the type of allergen when displayed and sold inside the school.

The administration reserves the right to amend, delete, or add according to the data and challenges, ensuring food safety based on the requirements mentioned in this article from item (1) to item (7).

### Article (10)
The placement of automated self-service food vending machines inside the school is prohibited.

### Article (11)
Prior approval from the Authority must be obtained before selling the following foods in the canteen or authorized sales points on special celebration days, provided they are supplied by a contractor previously approved by the Authority:
1. Boiled corn kernels.
2. Baked potatoes.
3. Ice cream, whether made from milk or frozen yogurt.
4. Fresh juices – smoothies.
5. And any other types of beverages, foods, and meals permitted by these regulations.

### Article (12)
The sale or circulation of the following prohibited food items in the canteen is forbidden:
1. Carbonated drinks of all types.
2. Evaporated or condensed milk, artificial colors, and sweeteners.
3. Fruit and nut syrups of all types, and flavored syrups or waters.
4. Sports drinks and foods.
5. Energy drinks and foods, and caffeinated beverages.
6. Chewing gum, lollipops, gelatin sweets, and all types of sugar.
7. Corn, potato, and grain crisps and puffs, salted, except for baked and low-salt varieties.
8. Fast food and all types of french fries.
9. Canned instant noodles.
10. Poultry and meat products, and processed and cured meats such as sausages, salami, pepperoni, and pastrami.
11. Pickles, mayonnaise, and high-calorie fatty sauces.
12. Any foods or beverages that contain any of the following additives:
    - Monosodium glutamate.
    - Artificial sweeteners.
    - Artificial flavors.
    - Artificial colors.
<page_end>24</page_end>

## Decision No. 1 / 70 - R / 2025
Governor of the Central Bank of Kuwait <orig>بنك الكويت المركزي</orig>
Having reviewed Article (21) of Law No. (32) of 1968 regarding Currency, the Central Bank of Kuwait <orig>بنك الكويت المركزي</orig>, and the Regulation of the Banking Profession, and its amendments.
And Articles (7), (10) of the Ministerial Decision of 1984 regarding subjecting exchange companies to the supervision of the Central Bank of Kuwait <orig>بنك الكويت المركزي</orig>.
And based on the request of Al-Mukhaizem Exchange Company <orig>شركة المخيزم للصرافة</orig> dated 2025/5/15 regarding the amendment of its data in the register of exchange companies at the Central Bank of Kuwait <orig>بنك الكويت المركزي</orig>.
### Has Decided
### Article One
The following amendments shall be recorded in the register of exchange companies at the Central Bank of Kuwait <orig>بنك الكويت المركزي</orig> for Al-Mukhaizem Exchange Company <orig>شركة المخيزم للصرافة</orig>:
- Increase in the legal reserve from 532,704 Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig> to 553,523 Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig>, in accordance with the company's final financial statements for the fiscal year ended 2024/12/31.
- Reappointment of Ms. Hessa Ibrahim Al Bin Ali <orig>حصة إبراهيم آل بن علي</orig> from Al-Jazeera Audit Office <orig>مكتب الجزيرة لتدقيق الحسابات</orig> as the company's auditor for the fiscal year ending 2025/12/31.
### Article Two
This decision shall be published in the Official Gazette and shall be effective from the date of its issuance.
The Governor

## Decision No. 1 / 71 - R / 2025

Secondly: Auction Terms:
First: The auction starts at the basic price. Participation in the auction requires payment of at least one-fifth of the price by a certified check from the drawee bank or by a letter of guarantee from one of the banks in favor of the Enforcement Department <orig>إدارة التنفيذ</orig> at the Ministry of Justice <orig>وزارة العدل</orig>.
Second: Whoever's bid is approved by the judge must deposit the full approved price, expenses, and registration fees at the time of the sale session.
Third: If the bidder whose bid was approved does not deposit the full price, they must deposit at least one-fifth of the price; otherwise, the bidding will be reopened at their expense in the same session based on the price at which the sale was previously awarded.
Fourth: If the first bidder fails to deposit the full price in the subsequent session and no one comes forward to bid immediately at one-tenth of the previous bid, the property will be sold based on the price at which it was awarded to them in the previous session. In this session, no bid not accompanied by a full deposit of its value will be considered. The defaulting bidder shall be liable for any shortfall in the property's price.
Sixth: In all cases, the successful bidder shall bear the transfer and registration fees for ownership, enforcement procedure expenses amounting to KWD 200, legal fees, and the cost and expenses of advertising and publishing the sale in daily newspapers.
Seventh: This announcement shall be published according to the law, and bidders shall request sale procedures at their own responsibility without the Clerk's Office <orig>إدارة الكتاب</orig> of the General Court <orig>المحكمة الكلية</orig> bearing any responsibility.
Eighth: The successful bidder acknowledges that they have inspected the property in a manner that negates ignorance.
Notice: 1- This sale announcement shall be published in the Official Gazette <orig>الجريدة الرسمية</orig> in accordance with Article 266 of the Code of Civil Procedure <orig>قانون المرافعات</orig>.
2- The auction award judgment is appealable within seven days from the date of its pronouncement, in accordance with Article 277 of the Code of Civil Procedure <orig>قانون المرافعات</orig>.
3- The last paragraph of Article 276 of the Code of Civil Procedure <orig>قانون المرافعات</orig> states that "If the person whose ownership has been divested is residing in the property, they shall remain in it as a tenant by force of law, and the successful bidder shall be obligated to draw up a lease contract in their favor at a fair market rent."

# Al-Kawthar Real Estate Company <orig>شركة الكوثر العقارية</orig> - A Kuwaiti <orig>كويتية</orig> Shareholding Company (Closed)
## Minutes of the Adjourned Extraordinary General Assembly Meeting of Al-Kawthar Real Estate Company <orig>شركة الكوثر العقارية</orig> K.S.C. (Closed)
Held on 2025/05/21 AD
On Wednesday, May 21, 2025 AD, the Adjourned Extraordinary General Assembly Meeting of Al-Kawthar Real Estate Company <orig>شركة الكوثر العقارية</orig> - a Kuwaiti <orig>كويتية</orig> Shareholding Company (Closed) - was held at 11:00 AM at the company's headquarters located in Al-Sharq <orig>الشرق</orig> area - Ahmed Al-Jaber <orig>احمد الجابر</orig> Street - Al-Awadhi Towers 2 <orig>أبراج العوضي 2</orig> - 3rd Floor - Office No. 3.
The meeting was chaired by Mr. Khalid Abdul Wahab Al-Essa <orig>خالد عبد الوهاب العيسى</orig>, in his capacity as Chairman of the Board of Directors.
• The total number of attending shares was 132,178,75 shares, in person and by proxy, representing 68.3020% of the company's total capital shares of 110,000,000 shares.
After confirming the availability of the legal quorum required for the validity of the company's Extraordinary General Assembly meeting, the Chairman of the Session welcomed the attendees, then announced the legal quorum, which was 68.3020% of the company's total capital shares, and then proceeded to present the items on the extraordinary agenda.
Firstly: The amendment of the text of Article (5) of the Articles of Association <orig>عقد التأسيس</orig> and Article (4) of the Bylaws <orig>النظام الأساسي</orig> was approved:
Text before amendment:
1- Owning, selling, and developing real estate and land for the company's account inside and outside the State of Kuwait <orig>دولة الكويت</orig>, as well as managing third-party properties, all in compliance with the provisions stipulated in existing laws and what they prohibit regarding trading in private residential plots as stipulated by these laws.
2- Owning, selling, and buying shares and bonds of real estate companies for the company's account only in Kuwait <orig>الكويت</orig>.
3- Preparing studies and providing consultations in all types of real estate fields, provided that the required conditions are met by those who provide this service.
4- Owning and managing hotels, health clubs, tourist facilities, and residential complexes, and leasing them, as well as managing third-party properties.
5- Carrying out maintenance work related to buildings and real estate owned by the company, including maintenance work, and executing civil, mechanical, electrical, elevator, and air conditioning works to ensure the preservation and safety of the buildings.
6- Managing, operating, investing, leasing, and renting hotels, clubs, motels, guesthouses, rest houses, parks, gardens, exhibitions, restaurants, cafeterias, residential complexes, tourist and health resorts, recreational and sports projects, and parties, at various grades and levels, including all original and auxiliary services, attached facilities, and other necessary services.
7- Organizing real estate exhibitions for the company's projects in accordance with the regulations in force at the Ministry.
8- Holding real estate auctions in accordance with the regulations in force at the Ministry.

# Kuwait Real Estate Company <orig>شركة عقارات الكويت</orig> K.S.C. Public
## Minutes of the Extraordinary General Assembly Meeting for the Financial Year Ended 2024/12/31
On Thursday, May 15, 2025, at 11:15 AM, the Extraordinary General Assembly Meeting of Kuwait Real Estate Company <orig>شركة عقارات الكويت</orig> K.S.C. Public was held at the company's headquarters located in Kuwait Stock Exchange Building <orig>مبنى سوق الكويت</orig>, Block (B), 8th Floor, Meeting Room, with the attendance of:
- Mr. Talal Jassim Al-Bahar <orig>طلال جاسم البحر</orig>, Vice Chairman of the Board of Directors (Chairman of the Meeting)
- Mr. Abdul Latif Mohammed Al-Aiban <orig>عبد اللطيف العيبان</orig>, Grant Thornton Office – Al-Qatami and Al-Aiban & Partners <orig>القطامي والعيبان وشركاهم</orig> (Auditors)
Shareholders representing 739,943,069 shares out of the total capital shares of 1,004,206,962 shares attended, with an attendance rate of 75.675%, after excluding treasury shares and restricted shares.
After the Chairman of the Meeting announced the completion of the legal quorum for holding the Extraordinary General Assembly meeting, the Assembly began discussing the agenda items, which resulted in the following decisions:
Item One:
Approval by a majority of attendees, with a percentage of 63.551%, to increase the company's authorized, issued, and fully paid-up capital of KWD 100,420,696.200 (One Hundred Million, Four Hundred Twenty Thousand, Six Hundred Ninety-Six Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig> and 200 Fils) by 6%, so that the company's capital after the increase becomes KWD 106,445,937.900 (One Hundred Six Million, Four Hundred Forty-Five Thousand, Nine Hundred Thirty-Seven Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig> and 900 Fils), by issuing 60,252,417 new shares, to be distributed as free bonus shares allocated to the shareholders registered in the company's records at the end of the entitlement day, which is 15 business days after the date of the General Assembly meeting, provided that they are distributed 5 business days after the end of the entitlement date.

# Al-Deera Holding Company <orig>شركة الديرة القابضة</orig> (K.S.C.P.) Public
Minutes of the Extraordinary General Assembly Meeting

On Wednesday, May 21, 2025, at 11:30 AM, the Extraordinary General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة غير العادية</orig> meeting of Al-Deera Holding Company <orig>شركة الديرة القابضة</orig> (K.S.C.P.) Public was held at the company's headquarters located in Kuwait Market <orig>سوق الكويت</orig> – Block A, 8th Floor, in the presence of Mr. Talal Bader Al-Bahar <orig>طلال بدر البحر</orig> – Chairman of the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> (and Chairman of the Meeting). Shareholders representing 84,188,085 shares out of the total capital of 103,241,880 shares, representing 81.538%, attended.
After the Chairman of the Meeting announced the completion of the legal quorum for holding the Extraordinary General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة غير العادية</orig> meeting, the Assembly began discussing the agenda items, which resulted in the following resolutions:

**Item One:**
- Unanimous approval by attendees to increase the company's capital from KWD 10,324,188.000 to KWD 11,356,606.800, by distributing free bonus shares at a rate of 10% of the capital, amounting to KWD 1,032,418.800, with a total number of bonus shares of 10,324,188 shares of capital, at a value of 100 fils per share.
- The free bonus shares shall be distributed to shareholders registered in the company's records at the end of the entitlement date, which is set at 29 working days after the date of the Extraordinary General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة غير العادية</orig> meeting, provided that they are distributed to shareholders 3 working days after the entitlement date, and authorizing the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> to dispose of fractional shares arising from the distribution of bonus shares as it deems appropriate, and to amend the aforementioned timeline in case the publication procedures are not completed eight working days before the entitlement date.

**Item Two:**
- Unanimous approval by attendees to amend Article (5) of the Articles of Incorporation <orig>عقد التأسيس</orig> and Article (5) of the Articles of Association <orig>النظام الأساسي</orig>.
Text of the Article before amendment:
The company's issued, authorized, and paid-up capital was set at KWD 10,324,188.000 (ten million, three hundred twenty-four thousand, one hundred eighty-eight Kuwaiti Dinars), distributed over 103,241,880 shares (one hundred three million, two hundred forty-one thousand, eight hundred eighty shares), with a value of 100 fils (one hundred fils) per share, and all shares are cash shares and fully paid.

### Kuwaiti Catalyst Manufacturing Company <orig>الشركة الكويتية لصناعة المواد الحفارة</orig> (K.S.C.C.)
#### Minutes of the Extraordinary General Assembly Meeting

The Extraordinary General Assembly meeting of Kuwaiti Catalyst Manufacturing Company <orig>الشركة الكويتية لصناعة المواد الحفارة</orig> – a Kuwaiti Shareholding Company (Closed) (the "Company") – was held at 11:00 AM on Monday, 2025/5/12, remotely via Microsoft Teams.
The meeting session was chaired by Mr. Rafed Abdullah Al-Rifai <orig>رافد عبدالله الرفاعي</orig> – Chairman of the Extraordinary General Assembly. The meeting was also attended by:
- Shareholders holding 24,173,057 shares, in person and by proxy, representing 91.162% of the total capital shares of 25,000,000 shares.

After the legal quorum for the validity of the meeting was met, the Chairman of the meeting, Mr. Rafed Al-Rifai <orig>رافد الرفاعي</orig>, opened the meeting session, welcoming the attendees, and then proceeded to present the items on the agenda of the Extraordinary General Assembly.
After discussing the items, the shareholders took the following decisions:
**Item One / Approval of Adding a New Purpose/Activity for the Company**
Approval was given to amend Article (5) of the Company's Articles of Incorporation and Article (4) of the Articles of Association, and to align the company's activities according to the International Standard Industrial Classification of All Economic Activities (ISIC), as follows:
- Before Amendment:
    1. Manufacturing, importing, and marketing of catalyst materials for crude oil refining and petrochemical industries.
    2. Providing consultations and technical support related to the use of catalyst materials.
    3. Designing and developing methods for manufacturing various types of catalyst materials.
    4. Executing all matters related to catalyst materials, including their transportation, shipping, and the loading and unloading of reactors.
    5. Utilizing the company's available financial surpluses by investing them in financial portfolios managed by specialized companies and entities, in compliance with the tolerant Islamic Sharia.
    6. Establishing and setting up catalyst manufacturing plants in Kuwait and the Middle East region.
    7. Marketing catalyst materials to users in Kuwait and the Middle East region, including opening foreign branches and agreeing with marketing agents.
    8. Marketing and developing catalytic manufacturing process technologies for crude oil refining and petrochemical industries.
    9. Treating and disposing of spent catalyst materials resulting from refining and petrochemical industries.
    10. Importing and manufacturing raw materials for catalyst materials.
    11. Importing and manufacturing various types of packaging materials specific to catalyst materials.
    12. Importing and supplying chemical and industrial materials and industrial equipment, either directly or through agencies, or by obtaining the necessary technology for manufacturing or marketing chemical materials inside or outside Kuwait, in accordance with the purposes for which the company was established (subject to the approval of the Public Authority for Industry <orig>الهيئة العامة للصناعة</orig>).

# National Petroleum Services Company (K.S.C.P.) <orig>الشركة الوطنية للخدمات البترولية (ش.م.ك.ع)</orig>
## Minutes of the Extraordinary General Assembly Meeting
Held on Sunday, May 25, 2025
at 8:30 AM.

The Extraordinary General Assembly of the National Petroleum Services Company (K.S.C.P.) <orig>الشركة الوطنية للخدمات البترولية (ش.م.ك.ع)</orig> held its meeting on Sunday, May 25, 2025, at 12:30 PM in Kiko Tower, located in "Sharq Area - 45th Floor". The meeting was chaired by Sheikh Sabah Mohammed Abdulaziz Al-Sabah <orig>الشيخ صباح محمد عبد العزيز الصباح</orig> - Chairman of the Board of Directors - and attended by:
- **First:** By electronic and direct attendance, shareholders representing - in person and by proxy - 81,774,519 shares, constituting 84.30% of the company's total shares after excluding treasury shares.
- **Second:** Mr. Mohammed Salem Essa Bouhadi <orig>محمد سالم عيسى بوهادي</orig>, representing the Kuwait Clearing Company <orig>الشركة الكويتية للمقاصة</orig>.

With the quorum for the Assembly being complete and available, the Chairman of the Assembly <orig>رئيس الجمعية</orig> opened the meeting, welcoming the attendees and thanking them for accepting the invitation. Subsequently, the Extraordinary General Assembly discussed the items on its agenda and issued the following resolutions:

- **First: Approval was given to amend Article No. (1) of the Articles of Association to read as follows:**
  - **Text before amendment:**
    - A Kuwaiti closed shareholding company <orig>شركة مساهمة كويتية مقفلة</orig> named National Petroleum Services Company K.S.C. On Tuesday, 2025/05/19, at 12:00 PM, the Extraordinary General Assembly Meeting of My Fatoorah Company for Electronic Payment Services <orig>شركة ماي فاتورة لتقديم خدمات الدفع الالكتروني</orig> (K.S.C.C.) was held at the company's head office, Kuwait Governorate <orig>محافظة الكويت</orig>, Sharq <orig>شرق</orig>, Al-Shuhada Street <orig>شارع الشهداء</orig>, KIPCO Tower <orig>برج كيبكو</orig>, 48th Floor, Meeting Room, with the attendance of:
*   Mr. Abdullah Deos Mubarak Al-Dabbous <orig>عبدالله ديوس مبارك الدبوس</orig> – Vice Chairman of the Board of Directors, CEO, and Chairman of the Meeting
*   Mr. Mohammed Bandar Al-Khawwas <orig>محمد بندر الخواص</orig> – Representative of Gulf Clearing Company <orig>الشركة الخليجية للمقاصة</orig>
*   Mr. Mohammed Hamad Taha Amin <orig>محمد حمد طه امين</orig> – Board Secretary
And with the attendance of shareholders representing 50,000,000 shares out of the total capital shares of 50,000,000 shares, with an attendance rate of 100%. After the Chairman of the Meeting announced the completion of the legal quorum for holding the Extraordinary General Assembly Meeting and welcomed the attendees, the items on the agenda were discussed, and the discussions resulted in the following resolutions:
Item One: Amendment of Article Four of the Articles of Association
Previous Article:
Without prejudice to Companies Law No. 1/2016 <orig>قانون الشركات رقم 2016/1</orig>, its amendments, and its executive regulations, the purposes for which the company was established are:
Electronic bill collection and through direct point-of-sale (POS) (641938).
Amended Article:
Without prejudice to Companies Law No. 1/2016 <orig>قانون الشركات رقم 2016/1</orig>, its amendments, and its executive regulations, the purposes for which the company was established are:
Provider of large-scale electronic influence services (6419364)
After the discussion of the agenda was concluded, the Chairman of the Meeting announced the end of the Ordinary General Assembly Meeting at 01:00 PM, and thanked everyone for their attendance and cooperation.

KFHIC Investment Company K.S.C.P. <orig>شركة كفيك للاستثمار ش.م.ك.ع</orig> held an Extraordinary General Assembly Meeting on Sunday, 2025/05/18, at 12:30 PM at the Marriott Courtyard Hotel, Sharq <orig>شرق</orig>, Al-Shuhada Street, Hall 5, 3rd Floor. The meeting was chaired by Mr. Waleed Mohammed Jassim Al-Saqer <orig>وليد محمد جاسم الصقر</orig>, Chairman of the Board of Directors. The following gentlemen attended:
First: Shareholders representing in person and by proxy 270,464,503 shares, constituting 83.867% of the total free shares of the company, which number 322,491,383 shares.

# Announcement
The Ministry of Interior / Wizarat Al-Dakhiliya <orig>وزارة الداخلية</orig> announces Practice No. (L.A.) 122 /2024-2025: Supply, operation, warranty, and maintenance of Body Worn Cameras – for the General Department of Security Systems / Al-Idara Al-Amma lil-Anzima Al-Amniya <orig>الإدارة العامة للأنظمة الأمنية</orig>.
Therefore, specialized companies / establishments in this field should refer to the General Department of Financial Affairs / Al-Idara Al-Amma lil-Shu'un Al-Maliya <orig>الإدارة العامة للشئون المالية</orig> – Tenders Department / Idarat Al-Munakasat <orig>إدارة المناقصات</orig> (in the Industrial Capital / Al-Asima Al-Sina'iya <orig>العاصمة الصناعية</orig>) to obtain the documents for this practice for a fee of (300/-) K.D. (Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig>) only, three hundred Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig> (via K-Net) (non-refundable). An initial guarantee of (20,000/-) K.D. (Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig>) for a period of (90 days) must be submitted (to be attached with the practice bid), noting that the final insurance for the practice is (10%) of the total contract value. Applicants must bring a copy of the practice announcement from the Official Gazette (Kuwait Today / Al-Kuwait Al-Youm <orig>الكويت اليوم</orig>) and the following documents:
- Valid registration receipt with the Ministry of Interior / Wizarat Al-Dakhiliya <orig>وزارة الداخلية</orig>. Or
- A registration request for registration with the Ministry and then purchasing the practice documents.
Please note that the closing date (submission of bids) is Monday, 7/7/2025, from (8:00) eight AM until (1:00) one PM. No bids submitted before or after the mentioned time will be accepted. Bids must be submitted to the Envelope Opening Committee / Lajnat Fadd Al-Mazareef <orig>لجنة فض المظاريف</orig> at the Ministry of Interior / Wizarat Al-Dakhiliya <orig>وزارة الداخلية</orig> building (Sharq Area / Mintaqat Sharq <orig>منطقة شرق</orig> – Al-Siddiq School / Madrasat Al-Siddiq <orig>مدرسة الصديق</orig> – First Floor).
A mandatory preliminary meeting will be held to answer inquiries from companies participating in the practice on Monday, 16/6/2025, at (10:00) AM at the headquarters of the General Department of Security Systems / Al-Idara Al-Amma lil-Anzima Al-Amniya <orig>الإدارة العامة للأنظمة الأمنية</orig>. Any recommendations or decisions resulting from this meeting are considered an integral part of the practice documents and are binding on all companies, whether the practitioner attended the mandatory preliminary meeting or not.

Tender Announcement No.: 240-8-14834-2411 for the Removal, Supply, and Installation of Overhead Cranes for Technical Workshops
The Ministry of Defense <orig>وزارة الدفاع</orig> announces the issuance of the above-mentioned tender to specialized companies for the year 2025, in accordance with the terms and specifications contained in the tender documents, which can be obtained from the Technical Equipment Department <orig>إدارة التجهيزات الفنية</orig> during official working hours. # Announcement

The Ministry of Health <orig>وزارة الصحة</orig> announces the offering of Practice No.: P.M. / S / 2025/2026 for the supply and installation of devices to complete the digital transformation of Al-Amiri Hospital <orig>مستشفى الأميري</orig> among companies specialized in this field and registered with the Central Agency for Information Technology <orig>الجهاز المركزي لتكنولوجيا المعلومات</orig>, in accordance with the general and special conditions, technical specifications, and practice documents, which can be obtained from the Ministry's website (www.moh.gov.kw), upon payment of a non-refundable amount of (75 K.D.) only seventy-five Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig>.
Compliance with the National Labor Support Law <orig>قانون دعم العمالة الوطنية</orig> is required, in accordance with Law No. 19 of 2000 and Cabinet Resolution No. 1104 (Fifth) of 2008 regarding the support and encouragement of national labor.
Please note that the closing date for the practice is at 1:00 PM on Monday, 2025/06/23, at the Tender Box in the General Office of the Ministry of Health <orig>وزارة الصحة</orig> (Sulaibikhat <orig>الصليبخات</orig> – Ministry Building – First Floor – Procurement Department <orig>إدارة المشتريات</orig> – Practices Section <orig>قسم الممارسات</orig>). Bids shall be valid for a period of (90) days from the closing date, and the initial guarantee shall be (2%) only of the bid value, valid for the entire duration of the bid's validity.
**Note**: Priority is given to owners of small and medium-sized enterprises affiliated with the National Fund for Small and Medium Enterprise Development <orig>الصندوق الوطني لتنمية المشروعات الصغيرة والمتوسطة</orig>.

Undersecretary of the Ministry of Health <orig>وكيل وزارة الصحة</orig>

## Ministry of Justice <orig>وزارة العدل</orig>
### Announcement of Car Sale
The General Department of Enforcement <orig>الإدارة العامة للتنفيذ</orig> announces that on Sunday, 1/6/2025, and the following three days, starting from 8:00 AM, the following cars will be sold by public auction at the Sales Seizure Garage <orig>كراج حجز البيوع</orig>, in execution of several judgments. Please note that the sale procedures will take place at the Sales Center <orig>مركز البيوع</orig> – Al-Ardiya Al-Hirafiya <orig>العارضية الحرفية</orig>.

## Minutes of Announcement of Factory Sale

The Ministry of Justice <orig>وزارة العدل</orig> - General Department of Enforcement <orig>الإدارة العامة للتنفيذ</orig> - Capital Governorate <orig>محافظة العاصمة</orig> – Enforcement File No. (22384271) announces that on Wednesday, 2025/6/18, starting from 10:00 AM, the movable assets of the factory known by the trade name "Saco Factory for the Production of Straw Utensils, Sticks, and Lids <orig>مصنع ساكو لإنتاج الأواني الشلمونيات الأعواد والأغطية</orig>" (Industrial Establishment License No. (200511) issued by the Public Authority for Industry <orig>الهيئة العامة للصناعة</orig> on 2016/4/12), located in Shuwaikh Industrial Area 2 <orig>منطقة الشويخ الصناعية 2</orig> – Block (D) – Plot (11) – Shop (6, 5) Ground Floor – Automated Address Number (21737941), will be sold by public auction. This is pursuant to Judgment No. 2023/17 Commercial /2 dated 2023/6/21, which became final due to non-appeal, and is mortgaged in favor of / New York Real Estate Company (LLC) <orig>شركة نيورك العقارية (ذ.م.م)</orig> (the Mortgagee Creditor), considering it a business with all its tangible and intangible components and elements, and in fulfillment of a debt amounting to K.D. 6,712.500 (six thousand seven hundred and twelve Dinars and 500 Fils), in addition to expenses and interest from that date until full payment, provided that the sale takes place at the factory premises and in accordance with the procedures stipulated in Article (44) of the Commercial Law. If this day is not sufficient to complete the sale, it will be completed on the following three days. It is noted that the Public Authority for Industry (the Authority) <orig>الهيئة العامة للصناعة (الهيئة)</orig> does not object to transferring the aforementioned industrial license and its associated benefits, including the right to the plots on which the factory is built, to the successful bidder, after paying the Authority the financial dues for the said plot.

Therefore, those wishing to purchase must inspect the factory with an inspection that negates ignorance and attend at the time and place specified above. For more information, the Compulsory Enforcement Department – Capital Governorate <orig>محافظة العاصمة</orig> can be consulted during official working hours, and for clarification, this announcement is made.

Head of Enforcement Department, Capital Governorate <orig>محافظة العاصمة</orig>

## Announcement of Real Estate Sale by Public Auction

the new one at seven AM – in execution of the court judgment issued in lawsuit No. 2011/74 Sales /1 filed by: Fatima Ahmed Saleh Anbar <orig>فاطمة احمد صالح عنبر</orig>.
1- Against: Hussein Abdullah Ibrahim Al-Haddad <orig>حسين عبدالله إبراهيم الحداد</orig>.
2- Kuwait Credit Bank <orig>بنك الائتمان الكويتي</orig>

**Property Description (According to the Attached Description Certificate)**
– Property Document No. 1994/19615 located in Sabah Al-Salem area <orig>صباح السالم</orig> – Plot (332) Block No. (6) Plan M/36977 – with an area of 417.2 m2, by public auction with a base price of K.D. 306,000 (three hundred and six thousand Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig>).

**According to the Description Certificate:**
1- There is an additional structure and an encroachment on the neighbor's side on the ground floor.
2- There is an additional structure with lightweight, large materials.

**According to the Expert's Report**
1- By virtue of a sale deed issued by the Real Estate Registration and Documentation Department <orig>إدارة التسجيل العقاري والتوثيق</orig> at the Ministry of Justice <orig>وزارة العدل</orig>, the disputed property located in Sabah Al-Salem suburb <orig>ضاحية صباح السالم</orig>, Block 6, Plot No. 332 of Plan No. M/36977, with an area of 417.2 m2, held in common ownership equally between them.

The inspection was carried out as follows: The disputed site is a private residential plot consisting of a ground floor and a first floor, overlooking two streets (corner plot). The exterior cladding is limestone, and the central air conditioning is old and out of order; the current air conditioning consists of separate units.
- The first defendant provided information about the components of the ground floor, which consists of a diwaniya <orig>ديوانية</orig> with its bathroom, a hall, a kitchen, and 2 bathrooms.
- The expert was unable to inspect the first floor, as the first defendant stated that he does not possess the first floor and that the possessor is the plaintiff's son. He stated that the first floor consists of a hall, 3 rooms, a kitchen, and two bathrooms.
- The first defendant stated that he is the occupant and possessor of the ground floor, and that the first floor is allocated to the plaintiff by virtue of a spatially prepared partition judgment, and that the current occupant is the plaintiff's son, and that the property is not leased to others and does not generate any income.
- The first defendant sufficed with the information he provided.
- The expert inspected the disputed site, and the consulted study expert collected the necessary data to prepare his report.
3- The expert sought the assistance of the study expert in the department to estimate the value of the buildings and structures and to estimate the value of the land on which those buildings are located, where he estimated the value of the buildings at K.D. 26,500 (twenty-six thousand five hundred Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig>) and the value of the land at K.D. 313,500 (three hundred and thirteen thousand five hundred Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig>), making the total value of the land and the buildings thereon K.D. 340,000

### Property Descriptions
The property subject of the lawsuit consists of a detached property with two sections connected by a separate side entrance, and each building has a separate main entrance from the outside. The first defendant's property is located on internal street No. 209, and the third defendant's property (brother of the first defendant) is located on the main street, as shown in the plan submitted by the plaintiff's agent and the inspection, and it is located on Gamal Abdel Nasser <orig>جمال عبد الناصر</orig> Street.

Internal property descriptions for the first defendant on internal street No. (209) according to the plan consist of:
- Two floors: ground and first, and a roof.
- The ground floor consists of a circular hall, a reception hall, a living room, three bedrooms with their bathrooms, three separate rooms, a preparatory kitchen, a main kitchen, a guest bathroom, and a staircase.
- The first floor consists of four bedrooms, three bathrooms, a preparatory kitchen, a hall, and washbasins.
- The roof consists of a water heater room, a maid's room, and a bathroom.

Internal property descriptions for the third defendant on Gamal Abdel Nasser <orig>جمال عبد الناصر</orig> Street, according to the plan submitted to the expert, consist of:
Two floors: ground and first, and a roof.
The ground floor consists of a circular hall, a living room, two bedrooms, a bathroom, a main kitchen, a staircase, and dining rooms.
The first floor consists of five bedrooms, a living room, and three bathrooms.
There are no rooms on the roof floor as shown in the sketch.
The study expert recorded observations and took into account the general and specific descriptions of the property subject of the lawsuit to estimate its value.

### Second: Auction Terms:
First: The auction begins at the base price. To participate in the auction, at least one-fifth of that price must be paid by a certified check from the drawee bank or by a letter of guarantee from one of the banks in favor of the Enforcement Department of the Ministry of Justice <orig>وزارة العدل</orig>.
Second: The bidder whose offer is approved by the judge must deposit the full approved price, expenses, and registration fees at the time of the sale session.
Third: If the bidder whose offer was approved does not deposit the full price, he must deposit at least one-fifth of the price, otherwise the bidding will be re-opened at his expense in the same session based on the price at which the sale was concluded.
Fourth: If the bidder deposits the price in the next session, the auction will be awarded to him, unless someone comes forward in that session willing to buy with a ten percent increase, accompanied by the deposit of the full auction price. In this case, the bidding will be re-opened in the same session based on this price.
Fifth: If the first bidder does not deposit the full price in the next session and no one comes forward with a ten percent increase, the bidding will be immediately re-opened at his expense based on the price at which it was awarded to him in the previous session, and no offer in this session will be considered unless accompanied by a deposit of its full value. The defaulting bidder is obligated to cover any shortfall in the property's price.
Sixth: The successful bidder shall bear, in all cases, the transfer and property registration fees, enforcement procedure expenses amounting to 200 K.D. <orig>د.ك</orig>, legal and expert fees, and advertising and publication expenses for the sale in daily newspapers.
Seventh: This announcement is published in accordance with the law, and those directly involved in the sale procedures are requested to proceed at their own responsibility, without the General Court's <orig>المحكمة الكلية</orig> Clerk's Office bearing any responsibility.
Eighth: The successful bidder acknowledges that he has inspected the property with an inspection that negates ignorance.

### Notice:
1- This sale announcement shall be published in the Official Gazette in accordance with Article 266 of the Code of Civil Procedure.
2- The auction award judgment is appealable within seven days from the date of its pronouncement, in accordance with Article 277 of the Code of Civil Procedure.
3- The last paragraph of Article 276 of the Code of Civil Procedure states that "If the person whose property has been expropriated is residing in the property, he shall remain in it as a tenant by force of law, and the successful bidder shall be obligated to draw up a lease contract in his favor at a fair market rent."

**Second: Auction Terms and Conditions:**
First: The auction shall commence at the base price. Participation in the auction requires payment of at least one-fifth of that price by a certified check from the drawee bank or by a letter of guarantee from one of the banks in favor of the Enforcement Department <orig>إدارة التنفيذ</orig> at the Ministry of Justice <orig>وزارة العدل</orig>.
Second: The bidder whose offer is approved by the judge must deposit the full approved price, expenses, and registration fees at the time of the sale session.
Third: If the bidder whose offer was approved fails to deposit the full price, they must deposit at least one-fifth of the price; otherwise, the bidding shall be reopened at their expense in the same session based on the price at which the sale was previously awarded.
Fourth: If the bidder deposits the price in the subsequent session, the auction shall be awarded to them, unless someone comes forward in that session willing to purchase with a ten percent increase, accompanied by the deposit of the full auction price. In this case, the bidding shall be reopened in the same session based on this new price.
Fifth: If the initial bidder fails to deposit the full price in the subsequent session and no one comes forward with a ten percent increase, the bidding shall immediately be reopened at their expense based on the price at which it was awarded to them in the previous session. No bid in this session shall be considered unless accompanied by the deposit of its full value. The defaulting bidder shall be liable for any shortfall in the property's price.
Sixth: In all cases, the successful bidder shall bear the transfer and registration fees for ownership, the expenses of enforcement procedures amounting to K.D. 200, legal and expert fees, and the costs of advertising and publishing the sale in daily newspapers.
Seventh: This announcement is published in accordance with the law, and those directly involved in the sale procedures are responsible for them, without the Clerk's Office <orig>إدارة الكتاب</orig> of the General Court <orig>المحكمة الكلية</orig> bearing any responsibility.

3- The last paragraph of Article 276 of the Code of Civil Procedure <orig>قانون المرافعات</orig> states that "If the person whose ownership has been divested is residing in the property, they shall remain therein as a tenant by operation of law, and the successful bidder shall be obliged to draw up a lease contract at a fair market rent".

- Secondly: Auction Terms:
First: The auction shall commence at the base price. Participation in the auction requires payment of at least one-fifth of that price by a certified check from the drawee bank or by a letter of guarantee from one of the banks in favor of the Enforcement Department <orig>إدارة التنفيذ</orig> at the Ministry of Justice <orig>وزارة العدل</orig>.
Second: The bidder whose offer is approved by the judge must deposit the full approved price, expenses, and registration fees at the time of the sale session.
Third: If the bidder whose offer was approved fails to deposit the full price, they must deposit at least one-fifth of the price, and the bidding shall be reopened at their expense in the same session, based on the price at which the sale was previously awarded.
Fourth: If the bidder deposits the price in the subsequent session, the auction shall be awarded to them, unless someone comes forward in that session willing to purchase with a ten percent increase, accompanied by the deposit of the full price. In this case, the bidding shall be reopened in the same session based on the price at which the sale was previously awarded.
Fifth: If the first bidder fails to deposit the full price in the subsequent session and no one else comes forward to bid, the bidding shall be immediately reopened at their expense based on the price at which it was awarded to them in the previous session. No offer in this session shall be considered unless accompanied by the deposit of its full value. The defaulting bidder shall be liable for any shortfall in the property's price.

Notice:

2. The auction award judgment is appealable within seven days from the date of its pronouncement, in accordance with Article 277 of the Code of Civil Procedure <orig>قانون المرافعات</orig>.
3. 17- Mariam Najm Abdullah Al-Failakawi <orig>مريم نجم عبدالله الفيلكاوي</orig>.
18- Jamata Najm Abdullah Al-Failakawi <orig>جماته نجم عبدالله الفيلكاوي</orig>.
19- Public Authority for Minors' Affairs <orig>الهيئة العامة لشئون القصر</orig> in its capacity as guardian of the minor / Siriyah Najm Abdullah Al-Failakawi <orig>صيريه نجم عبدالله الفيلكاوي</orig>.
20- Ibrahim Yassin Yaqoub Malallah <orig>إبراهيم ياسين يعقوب مال الله</orig> in his capacity as natural guardian of his minor son Ahmed Ibrahim Yassin Yaqoub Malallah <orig>أحمد إبراهيم ياسين يعقوب مال الله</orig>, heir of the late / Luluwa Najm Abdullah Al-Failakawi <orig>لولوه نجم عبدالله الفيلكاوي</orig>.
21- Undersecretary of the Ministry of Justice <orig>وزارة العدل</orig> in his capacity as the Supreme Head of the Real Estate Registration Department <orig>إدارة التسجيل العقاري</orig>.
Property Description:
Property Document No. 1998/17434, located in Salwa <orig>سلوى</orig> area – Plot No. 288 – Block No. 2 – from Plan No. M/33777, with an area of 825m2. This will be offered in a public auction with a base price of (620,000 KWD) six hundred twenty thousand Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig>.
** According to the Description Certificate <orig>شهادة الأوصاف</orig>.
The property is a private residence consisting of a ground floor + first floor + second floor + roof + property annexes.
** According to the Expert's Report <orig>تقرير الخبير</orig>:
The property is located in Salwa <orig>سلوى</orig> area – Block 2 – Street 8, House No. 9 – Automated Number (11840005). The inspection was carried out as follows:
1. The disputed property conforms in terms of general and specific specifications to Document No. 1998/17434 and has an area of 825m2.
2. The property subject of the lawsuit is a private residence in an old structural condition, overlooking one street and a back alley overlooking a school. It is bordered by neighbors on both sides, has 1 entrance from the street side and 1 entrance from the alley side, and its exterior cladding is made of Jordanian stone.
3. The property subject of the lawsuit consists of a ground floor, first floor, second floor, roof, and a courtyard with an annex. The second plaintiff provided guidance on the property's components, which are detailed as follows:
- The annex consists of: The annex is divided into two parts, each part consisting of 2 rooms + kitchen + bathroom, with window air conditioning, and rented to others.
- The ground floor up to the second floor consists of two apartments per floor. The second plaintiff stated that the components of all apartments are identical, and since they are rented to others, apartment No. 4 on the first floor was inspected under the guidance of the second plaintiff, and it consists of a hall + 2 rooms + kitchen + bathroom + master bedroom with bathroom and dressing area.
The roof has no components. The type of air conditioning in the property subject of the lawsuit is central, and there is an elevator in the property.
Second: Auction Conditions:
First: The auction shall start at the base price. Participation in the auction requires payment of at least one-fifth of that price by a certified check from the drawee bank or by a letter of guarantee from one of the banks in favor of the Enforcement Department <orig>إدارة التنفيذ</orig> at the Ministry of Justice <orig>وزارة العدل</orig>.
Second: The bidder whose offer is approved by the judge must deposit, at the time of the sale session, the full approved price, expenses, and registration fees.
Third: If the bidder whose offer was approved does not deposit the full price, they must deposit at least one-fifth of the price; otherwise, the bidding will be reopened at their expense in the same session, based on the price at which the sale was awarded.
Fourth: If the bidder deposits the price in the subsequent session, the auction shall be awarded to them, unless someone comes forward in that session willing to purchase with a ten percent increase, accompanied by the deposit of the full auction price. In this case, the bidding shall be reopened in the same session based on this new price.
Fifth: If the first bidder fails to deposit the full price in the subsequent session and no one comes forward to bid with a ten percent increase, the bidding shall be immediately reopened at their expense based on the price at which it was awarded to them in the previous session. In this session, no bid not accompanied by the deposit of its full value shall be considered. The defaulting bidder shall be liable for any shortfall in the property's price.
Sixth: In all cases, the successful bidder <orig>الراسي عليه المزاد</orig> shall bear the fees for transfer and registration of ownership, enforcement procedure expenses amounting to 200 KWD, and legal and expert fees.

Secondly: Auction Terms:
Firstly: The auction shall commence at the basic price indicated for the property. Participation in the auction requires payment of at least one-fifth of that price by a certified check from the drawee bank or by a letter of guarantee from one of the banks in favor of the Enforcement Department <orig>إدارة التنفيذ</orig> at the Ministry of Justice <orig>وزارة العدل</orig>.
Secondly: Whoever's bid is approved by the judge must deposit the full approved price, expenses, and registration fees at the time of the sale session.
Thirdly: If the bidder whose bid was approved does not deposit the full price, he must deposit at least one-fifth of the price; otherwise, the bidding will be reopened at his expense in the same session based on the price at which the sale was previously awarded.
Fourthly: If the bidder deposits the price in the subsequent session, the auction shall be awarded to him, unless someone comes forward in that session who accepts to purchase with a ten percent increase, accompanied by a full deposit in the auction. In this case, the bidding will be reopened in the same session based on this price.
Fifthly: If the first bidder fails to deposit the full price in the subsequent session and no one comes forward with a ten percent increase, the bidding will be immediately reopened at his expense based on the price at which it was awarded to him in the previous session. No bid in this session will be considered unless accompanied by a full deposit of its value. The defaulting bidder shall be liable for any shortfall in the property's price.

Decree No. (12) of 2024
Regarding the amendment of some provisions of Decree No. (15) of 1979
Concerning the Civil Service System
Having reviewed the Constitution,
And Decree-Law No. (15) of 1979 concerning the Civil Service System and its amendments,
And Decree No. (12) of 2024 amending some provisions of the aforementioned Decree No. (15) of 1979,
And based on the submission of the Prime Minister <orig>رئيس مجلس الوزراء</orig>,
And after the approval of the Council of Ministers <orig>مجلس الوزراء</orig>,
We have decreed the following:

<table>
| Article | Original Text | Amended Text |
|---|---|---|
| 1 | Employees shall be appointed to vacant positions. | Employees shall be appointed to vacant positions in accordance with the provisions of this Decree. |
| 2 | The executive regulations shall specify the conditions for appointment. | The executive regulations shall specify the conditions and controls for appointment. |
</table>

Article (1)
The text of Article (1) of the aforementioned Decree No. (15) of 1979 shall be replaced with the following text:
"Employees shall be appointed to vacant positions in accordance with the provisions of this Decree."
Article (2)
The text of Article (2) of the aforementioned Decree No. (15) of 1979 shall be replaced with the following text:
"The executive regulations shall specify the conditions and controls for appointment."
Article (3)
The Prime Minister <orig>رئيس مجلس الوزراء</orig> and the Ministers – each within their respective jurisdiction – shall implement this Decree, and it shall come into force from the date of its publication in the Official Gazette <orig>الجريدة الرسمية</orig>.
Issued at Seif Palace <orig>قصر السيف</orig> on: 10 Sha'ban 1445 AH <orig>10 شعبان 1445 هـ</orig>
Corresponding to: 20 February 2024 AD <orig>20 فبراير 2024 م</orig>

Ms. Fulla Faraj Mansour Al-Sayeh <orig>فله فرج منصور السايح</orig> appeared before the Sharia Documentation Department <orig>إدارة التوثيقات الشرعية</orig>, accompanied by two witnesses: Ahmed Abdullah Hamoud Al-Tawheed <orig>أحمد عبدالله حمود التوحيد</orig> (Kuwaiti nationality) and Fayez Abdullah Hamoud Al-Tawheed <orig>فايز عبدالله حمود التوحيد</orig> (Kuwaiti nationality), and requested an inheritance inventory for the deceased: Raqiya Sharif Mudhi Al-Saqr <orig>راقيه شريف مضحي الصقر</orig> [Kuwaiti nationality], who passed away on 2025/4/22. After the aforementioned period has elapsed, the customary procedures in this regard will be taken. For clarification, we announce this.

Undersecretary of the Ministry of Finance <orig>وكيل وزارة المالية</orig>

Announcement of Sale by Sealed Bid Auction
Auction No. (2468) and Auction No. (2469)
The Ministry of Finance <orig>وزارة المالية</orig> announces the sale of (115) vehicles (Group Six): 101 partially damaged and 14 totally damaged, and the sale of (5861) batteries of various sizes and types, out of use, by sealed bid auction at the Ministry of Interior <orig>وزارة الداخلية</orig>, according to the following details:
1- Location for receiving the terms and conditions booklet and participation offer for both auctions: a. Auction No. (2468): Ministry of Interior <orig>وزارة الداخلية</orig> - General Department of Supply <orig>الإدارة العامة للإمداد</orig> "Vehicles Department <orig>إدارة الآليات</orig>" - Subhan <orig>صبحان</orig> - for a fee of (100 K.D.), b. Auction No. (2469): Ministry of Interior <orig>وزارة الداخلية</orig> - General Department of Supply <orig>الإدارة العامة للإمداد</orig> "Warehouses Department <orig>إدارة المخازن</orig>" in Shuwaikh <orig>الشويخ</orig> for a fee of (50 K.D.) to be paid at the Ministry of Interior <orig>وزارة الداخلية</orig> fund, from 2025/6/1 to 2025/6/4, noting that two separate documents will be sold, which are:
a- Auction No. (2468) document for the sale of (115) vehicles (Group Six): 101 partially damaged and 14 totally damaged.
b- Auction No. (2469) document for the sale of (5861) batteries of various sizes and types.
The bidder will sign a declaration and undertaking upon receiving the terms and conditions booklet to adhere to the specified deadline for submitting the offer to the Central Sales Committee <orig>لجنة البيع المركزي</orig> at the Ministry of Finance <orig>وزارة المالية</orig>.
2- Inspection Date: (4) working days from 2025/6/1 – 2025/6/4.
Inspection Time: During official working hours.
3- Location for receiving those interested in inspection for both auctions:
a. Auction No. (2468): Ministry of Interior <orig>وزارة الداخلية</orig> site - Mina Abdullah <orig>ميناء عبدالله</orig> Scrap.
b. Auction No. (2469): Ministry of Interior <orig>وزارة الداخلية</orig> site - Exhaust and Sixth Ring Road <orig>الدائري السادس</orig> Scrap.
4- Date of Submission and Opening of Envelopes:
* Submission of offers on Sunday, 2025/6/15, at the Ministry of Finance <orig>وزارة المالية</orig> – Ministries Complex <orig>مجمع الوزارات</orig> – Block 12 – Third Floor – General Storage Affairs Department <orig>إدارة شؤون التخزين العامة</orig> – Central Sales Section <orig>قسم البيع المركزي</orig> according to the deadline specified for the bidder by the Ministry of Interior <orig>وزارة الداخلية</orig> (no offer will be accepted after the bidder's specified deadline).
* Opening of envelopes and holding of the auction on Monday, 2025/6/16, at the Ministry of Finance <orig>وزارة المالية</orig> – Ministries Complex <orig>مجمع الوزارات</orig> – Block 12 – Third Floor – General Storage Affairs Department <orig>إدارة شؤون التخزين العامة</orig>.
* Announcement of the successful bidder on the Ministry of Finance <orig>وزارة المالية</orig> website on Monday, 2025/6/16.
* Delivery of checks to unsuccessful bidders on Tuesday, 2025/6/17.
* Submission of certified checks / bank guarantee in the name of the Ministry of Interior <orig>وزارة الداخلية</orig>.
* Special Conditions for Bidders:
* The bidder must be Kuwaiti – an individual or a company – registered in the Commercial Register <orig>السجل التجاري</orig> and with the Kuwait Chamber of Commerce and Industry <orig>غرفة تجارة وصناعة الكويت</orig>. A foreigner may participate provided they have a Kuwaiti partner or commercial agent with a notarized contract. (Must attach: copy of Chamber of Commerce and Industry certificate, copy of company license, copy of civil ID, and an authorization letter approved by the Chamber of Commerce and Industry, all valid).
* Special Conditions for Auction No. (2468):
- Kuwaiti individuals are allowed to participate in the auction (a copy of the civil ID must be attached).

5- The winning company in the auction shall provide proof of reviewing the Environment Public Authority <orig>الهيئة العامة للبيئة</orig> and submitting an environmental plan that includes a description and quantities of the materials to be handled, the mechanism of their handling, the transporting companies, and the treatment methods.

# The Amiri Diwan <orig>الديوان الأميري</orig>

## Practice No. (DA/803)
### Supply of Kuwaiti and Oriental Sweets to the Amiri Diwan <orig>الديوان الأميري</orig>

The Amiri Diwan <orig>الديوان الأميري</orig> announces the launch of Practice No. (DA/803) for the supply of Kuwaiti and Oriental sweets to the Amiri Diwan <orig>الديوان الأميري</orig>. Companies or specialized establishments wishing to participate in this field should apply to obtain the booklet of terms and conditions and practice documents during official working hours from (Amiri Diwan <orig>الديوان الأميري</orig> - Bayan Palace <orig>قصر بيان</orig> - Administrative Building - First Floor - Zone 7 - Tenders and Follow-up Department), during official working hours starting from the date of publication of the announcement in the Official Gazette (Kuwait Today / Al-Kuwait Al-Youm <orig>الكويت اليوم</orig>) for a fee of (750 K.D.) only seven hundred and fifty Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig> (K-Net payment only) for the non-refundable booklet. Owners of small and medium enterprises are exempt from these fees (upon submission of a supporting certificate). This is effective from 8:30 AM until 1:00 PM, taking into account the following: The deadline for submitting bids is 1:00 PM on Wednesday, 2025/06/18, and no bids will be accepted after this time.

1.  Bids shall be submitted in a sealed envelope to the Tenders and Follow-up Department - Bayan Palace <orig>قصر بيان</orig> - Administrative Building - First Floor - Zone 7.
2.  Submission of an initial security deposit of not less than (750 K.D.) only in favor of the Amiri Diwan <orig>الديوان الأميري</orig> in the form of a letter of guarantee or a certified check from one of the Kuwaiti banks, valid throughout the bid validity period of (90) days.
3.  Submission of a valid national labor percentage compliance certificate and a valid tax compliance certificate.
4.  A letter of authorization and a copy of the civil ID for the company representative to purchase the practice document.
5.  This practice is indivisible, and alternative offers are not permitted.
6.  The practitioner must submit a letter accompanied by a copy of the registration certificate with the Kuwait Chamber of Commerce and Industry <orig>غرفة تجارة وصناعة الكويت</orig>.
7.  The preliminary meeting is scheduled for Sunday, 2025/06/15, at 10:00 AM at (Amiri Diwan <orig>الديوان الأميري</orig> - Bayan Palace <orig>قصر بيان</orig> - Administrative Building - First Floor - Zone 7 - Tenders and Follow-up Department). The bid must remain valid for (90) days from the closing date, with the Amiri Diwan <orig>الديوان الأميري</orig> reserving its right to extend or renew this period for such duration(s) as it deems appropriate to complete the award procedures.

For inquiries:
- Email: hm.almutairi@da.gov.kw
- Direct: 22011425

Undersecretary for Financial, Administrative, and Management Affairs

# Public Authority for Disability Affairs <orig>الهيئة العامة لشئون ذوي الإعاقة</orig>

## Announcement

The Public Authority for Disability Affairs <orig>الهيئة العامة لشئون ذوي الإعاقة</orig> announces the launch of Practice No. (2-2025/2026) for the purchase of ANTIVIRUS Virtual System Licenses for the Public Authority for Disability Affairs <orig>الهيئة العامة لشئون ذوي الإعاقة</orig>, according to the terms and specifications outlined in the booklet of terms and conditions and practice documents, which can be obtained from the website of the Public Authority for Disability Affairs <orig>الهيئة العامة لشئون ذوي الإعاقة</orig> (Tenders Department - Building opposite the General Registry Building) (Hawally <orig>حولي</orig> - Block 11 - Beirut Street opposite Al-Bayan Bilingual School <orig>مدرسة البيان ثنائية اللغة</orig>) during official working hours from 10:00 AM until 2:00 PM, as follows:

1.  The deadline for submitting bids is 1:00 PM on Wednesday, 2025/06/18, and no bids will be accepted after this time.
2.  Bids shall be submitted in a sealed envelope to the Tenders and Follow-up Department - Bayan Palace <orig>قصر بيان</orig> - Administrative Building - First Floor - Zone 7.
3.  Submission of an initial security deposit of not less than (750 K.D.) only in favor of the Amiri Diwan <orig>الديوان الأميري</orig> in the form of a letter of guarantee or a certified check from one of the Kuwaiti banks, valid throughout the bid validity period of (90) days.
4.  Submission of a valid national labor percentage compliance certificate and a valid tax compliance certificate.
5.  A letter of authorization and a copy of the civil ID for the company representative to purchase the practice document.
6.  This practice is indivisible, and alternative offers are not permitted.
7.  The practitioner must submit a letter accompanied by a copy of the registration certificate with the Kuwait Chamber of Commerce and Industry <orig>غرفة تجارة وصناعة الكويت</orig>.
8.  The preliminary meeting is scheduled for Sunday, 2025/06/15, at 11:30 AM at (Amiri Diwan <orig>الديوان الأميري</orig> - Bayan Palace <orig>قصر بيان</orig> - Administrative Building - First Floor - Zone 7 - Tenders and Follow-up Department). The bid must remain valid for (90) days from the closing date, with the Amiri Diwan <orig>الديوان الأميري</orig> reserving its right to extend or renew this period for such duration(s) as it deems appropriate to complete the award procedures.

# Public Authority for Applied Education and Training <orig>الهيئة العامة للتعليم التطبيقي والتدريب</orig>

## Announcement

The Public Authority for Applied Education and Training <orig>الهيئة العامة للتعليم التطبيقي والتدريب</orig> announces the publication of an advertisement for Tender No. PAAET / SMA / 7 - 2025/2024 for the exploitation of Public Authority for Applied Education and Training <orig>الهيئة العامة للتعليم التطبيقي والتدريب</orig> sites to provide coin-operated automatic vending machine services for hot beverages (coffee + tea) (non-divisible) for a total of (95) machines for a period of 3 years.
According to the terms and specifications contained in the tender documents.
Companies and institutions wishing to participate in this tender should visit the Public Authority for Applied Education and Training <orig>الهيئة العامة للتعليم التطبيقي والتدريب</orig> website (www.paaet.edu.kw) to purchase the tender bid listed under Electronic Services (General Services) for a non-refundable fee of (K.D. 1000).
Bids are to be submitted at the Authority's General Office <orig>ديوان عام الهيئة</orig> located in Shuwaikh Educational Area <orig>منطقة الشويخ التعليمية</orig> – Supplies Department <orig>إدارة التوريدات</orig>, 7th Floor, within (one month) from this date. The site inspection for the service locations will be one week after the tender announcement date. The preliminary meeting will be held two weeks before the closing date at the Supplies Department <orig>إدارة التوريدات</orig> at 10:00 AM.

Note:
*   This announcement is considered an integral part of the practice documents.
*   The Authority may cancel the practice without stating reasons and without any objection from the practitioners.
*   For more information, please visit the website of the Public Authority for Sport <orig>الهيئة العامة للرياضة</orig> (Pas.gov.kw).

Acting Deputy Director General for Finance and Administrative Affairs Sector

Announcement
The Public Authority for Sport <orig>الهيئة العامة للرياضة</orig> announces the launch of Practice No. A.D. / 16 / 2025/2026 regarding electrical maintenance works and replacement of lighting fixtures for squash courts at the Kuwait Squash Federation <orig>الاتحاد الكويتي للاسكواش</orig>, by sealed envelopes in accordance with the terms and specifications contained in the practice documents, which can be obtained from the Services and Supplies Department – Tenders and Practices Section – Ground Floor, Office No. (5) at the Authority's headquarters in Al-Riqqa <orig>الرقعي</orig> area during official working hours or through the website of the Public Authority for Sport <orig>الهيئة العامة للرياضة</orig> (Pas.gov.kw/tenders)

<table_caption>Tender Details and Requirements</table_caption>
<table>
| Submission Date | Closing Date | Document Price | Initial Guarantee |
|:---|:---|:---|:---|
| 2025/6/1    | 2025/6/19    | 75 Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>ديناراً كويتياً</orig> | (K.D. 1,500) only One Thousand Five Hundred Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig> by certified check or a letter of guarantee valid for (90) days in favor of the Public Authority for Sport <orig>الهيئة العامة للرياضة</orig> from the closing date |
</table>

A preliminary meeting for bidders has been scheduled to be held at the Authority's headquarters (First Floor) at 11:00 AM on Tuesday, 2025/6/10 AD.

Bids must be submitted from 9:00 AM until 2:00 PM on the closing date, and bids must be delivered in sealed envelopes with red wax, and placed in the box designated for practices at the Authority's headquarters (Ground Floor). No bids received after the specified closing time for the practice will be accepted.
*   Practitioners must adhere to the instructions regarding bid submission (CD) on the website of the Public Authority for Sport <orig>الهيئة العامة للرياضة</orig> (Pas.gov.kw/tenders).
*   Companies / practitioners wishing to submit inquiries or clarifications, etc., must do so at the time and place specified above in the preliminary social schedule (inquiry session). No inquiries will be considered after the deadline.
*   All documents must be submitted on a (CD) and a non-copyable hard copy, except for the bid form and initial insurance, which must be submitted as a hard copy.

Bids shall be valid for (90) ninety days from the date of bid opening. Any bid not accompanied by the original or a copy of the receipt for purchasing the practice documents, the initial guarantee, and the national labor support certificate issued by the Public Authority for Manpower <orig>الهيئة العامة للقوى العاملة</orig> for the year 2025 will be excluded.
*   The bidder must attach a valid 'To Whom It May Concern' certificate issued by the Public Authority for Manpower <orig>الهيئة العامة للقوى العاملة</orig> stating that there is no suspension on the practitioner's file regarding government contracts registered with the Authority or any of the violations mentioned in Article (10) of Law No. 8 of 2010 concerning work in the private sector. Please note that any bid not including this certificate will be excluded.
*   The bidder must attach a valid 'To Whom It May Concern' certificate issued by the Ministry of Electricity, Water and Renewable Energy <orig>وزارة الكهرباء والماء والطاقة المتجددة</orig> stating clearance from consumption debts.

The practice is open to all companies and establishments specialized in the required works and registered with the Public Authority for Sport <orig>الهيئة العامة للرياضة</orig> and the Central Agency for Public Tenders <orig>الجهاز المركزي للمناقصات العامة</orig> for the year 2025, for a fee of (K.D. 75) only seventy-five Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>ديناراً كويتياً</orig>, payable via K-Net (non-refundable except in cases stipulated by Ministry of Finance <orig>وزارة المالية</orig> circulars), accompanied by the following:
1- A copy of the practice announcement in the Official Gazette.
2- A copy of the company's registration with the Authority for the year 2025.
3- A written letter of authorized delegation with the Authority, accompanied by (a copy of the Civil ID – a copy of the signature authorization).

*   Owners of small and medium-sized enterprises <orig>المشروعات الصغيرة والمتوسطة</orig> are exempted from the fees prescribed for purchasing practice documents, in accordance with the text of Article (39) of Law No. 74/1994 regarding amendments to Public Tenders Law No. (49/2016).
*   Owners of small and medium-sized enterprises <orig>المشروعات الصغيرة والمتوسطة</orig> wishing to apply for the practice must attach with their bid a valid certificate issued by the National Fund for Small and Medium Enterprise Development and Care <orig>الصندوق الوطني لرعاية وتنمية المشروعات الصغيرة والمتوسطة</orig>, indicating their accreditation as a small or medium enterprise.

In accordance with the text of Article (48) of Public Tenders Law No. (49 of 2016 AD), which states: "Bid envelopes shall be opened at the time and place specified in the practice documents in a public session in the presence of bidders or their representatives."
*   This announcement serves as an invitation for interested practitioners to attend, as interested companies have the right to attend the bid opening session by coordinating with the competent committee before the day of the session.

Announcement
The Public Authority for Industry <orig>الهيئة العامة للصناعة</orig> announces that Mr. Faleh Hantoush Faleh Al-Ajmi <orig>فالح حنتوش فالح العجمي</orig> has applied for a replacement for a lost deed for plot number (108), block number (1) (South Amghara <orig>جنوب أمغرة</orig>). Anyone in possession of the aforementioned plot deed or having any information regarding it is requested to report to the Public Authority for Industry <orig>الهيئة العامة للصناعة</orig> headquarters (Ground Floor), Licenses and Industrial Registry Department, within two weeks from the date of this announcement. Consequently, after the deadline expires, the Authority will issue a replacement for the requested deed.

Memorandum of Association of a Limited Liability Company (LLC)

Second: Trung Nam Construction Investments Company <orig>شركة ترونج نام للاستثمارات الإنشائية</orig>, Vietnamese nationality, Civil ID/Passport No. (0303543710), place of residence (Vietnam), Party Two.
Signing on behalf of (Party Two) is Mr. Mohammed Khalid Mohammed Al-Khader <orig>محمد خالد محمد الخضر</orig> (Kuwaiti national, holding Civil ID No. 255100400196) in his capacity as an agent by virtue of a power of attorney issued by the Socialist Republic of Vietnam <orig>جمهورية فيتنام الاشتراكية</orig> under No. (675-024-POA-TNG) dated 17-9-2024, duly attested by all competent authorities, most recently the Kuwaiti Ministry of Foreign Affairs <orig>وزارة الخارجية الكويتية</orig> on 22-10-2024. Company Name / Al-Sahab Tronfnam Green Energy Company / Limited Liability Company (LLC) <orig>شركة الطاقة الخضراء السحاب ترونفنام / ذات مسؤولية محدودة (ذ.م.م) هادفة للربح</orig> (For-Profit) Address: Limited Liability Company (LLC)
Company Capital: 100,000 Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig> / One Hundred Thousand Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig>
The parties agreed among themselves and affirmed the establishment of a limited liability company in accordance with the provisions of Companies Law No. 1 of 2016 and its executive regulations, and the provisions of Law No. 116 of 2013 regarding the promotion of direct investment in the State of Kuwait <orig>دولة الكويت</orig> and its executive regulations, and in accordance with the rules, controls, foundations, and standards issued by the Board of Directors of the Kuwait Direct Investment Promotion Authority <orig>هيئة تشجيع الاستثمار المباشر</orig>. The company shall acquire legal personality from the date of its registration in the Commercial Register, and the company may not engage in its activities until after its publication in the Official Gazette <orig>الجريدة الرسمية</orig>, obtaining licenses and approvals from regulatory bodies for engaging in the activity, and their commitment to all established rules for company formation, in accordance with the provisions stipulated in the following articles:

*   Owners of small and medium-sized enterprises <orig>المشروعات الصغيرة والمتوسطة</orig> are exempted from the prescribed fees for purchasing practice documents, in accordance with the text of Article (39) of Law No. 74/2019 regarding amendments to Public Tenders Law No. (49/2016).
*   Owners of small and medium-sized enterprises <orig>المشروعات الصغيرة والمتوسطة</orig> wishing to apply for the practice must attach with their bid a valid certificate issued by the National Fund for Small and Medium Enterprise Care and Development <orig>الصندوق الوطني لرعاية وتنمية المشروعات الصغيرة والمتوسطة</orig>, including project approval or average duration, in accordance with the text of Article (48) of Public Tenders Law No. (49 of 2016), which stipulates the opening of bid envelopes at the time and place specified in the practice documents in a public session attended by bidders or their representatives.
*   This announcement serves as an invitation for interested practitioners to attend, as companies wishing to attend the bid opening session have the right to coordinate with the competent committee before the day the session is held.
*   This announcement is considered an integral part of the practice documents.
Note: The Authority may cancel the practice without stating reasons and without any objection from the practitioners.
*   For more information, please visit the website of the Public Authority for Sport <orig>الهيئة العامة للرياضة</orig> (Pas.gov.kw).

Deputy Director General for Financial and Administrative Affairs and Assignment

Rights and Obligations of Company Management

Article (8)
The company is managed by
