Article (9)
The managers represent the company in its relations with third parties and before the judiciary, "individually or collectively," and have the broadest authority to deal on its behalf and conclude all contracts and transactions falling within the company's purposes, specifically appointing, suspending, and dismissing the company's agents and employees, determining their salaries, wages, and bonuses, receiving and paying amounts, signing, transferring, and concluding all contracts, agreements, and deals related to the company's transactions and achieving its objectives, whether in cash or on credit, and authorizing whomever they wish in all or some of the management powers. They also have the right to open bank accounts.
The manager may not make donations or sell the company's real estate unless the disposition falls within the company's purposes, nor may they mortgage the company's assets, sell or mortgage the company's store, borrow, guarantee third-party debts, arbitrate for reconciliation, or reconcile and release.
The managers shall be jointly and severally liable towards the company, the partners, and third parties for their violation of the provisions of the law and this contract or for errors in management, in accordance with the rules stipulated in the chapter on joint-stock companies in Companies Law No. 1 of 2016 <orig>قانون الشركات رقم 1 لسنة 2016</orig>, as amended by Law No. 15 of 2017 <orig>القانون رقم 15 لسنة 2017</orig>, and its executive regulations.

Article (10)
A company manager may not manage another competing company or a company with similar purposes, or contract with the company for their own account or for the account of a third party, unless this is done with permission issued by the Ordinary General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة العادية</orig> of the company.

Article (11)
Non-managing partners have the right to inspect the company's books and documents at the company's headquarters, either personally or through an agent, and to obtain photocopies thereof, as well as a brief statement of the company's financial status.
Each partner has the right to request from the company manager any information related to the company's operations, contracts and dispositions concluded with it, or its financial position. The manager is obligated to respond to such information within a maximum period of fifteen days from the date the company receives the request.
Auditor

Article (12)
The company shall have one or more auditors to audit the company's accounts. The rules and provisions stipulated for auditors in joint-stock companies in Companies Law No. 1 of 2016 <orig>قانون الشركات رقم 1 لسنة 2016</orig>, Articles 227 to 233, shall apply to the auditor regarding their appointment, powers, remuneration, dismissal, and resignation.

Article (13)
The company must keep at its head office all records, ledgers, and data contained therein, as stipulated in the executive regulations of Companies Law No. 1 of

Company Name and Commercial Address

Article (1)
Company Name / Al-Sahab Trofonam Green Energy Company <orig>شركة الطاقة الخضراء السحاب تروفونام</orig> / Limited Liability Company (LLC) <orig>ذات مسؤولية محدودة (ذ.م.م)</orig> for profit, domiciled in the State of Kuwait <orig>دولة الكويت</orig>.
Company's Head Office

Article (2)
The company's head office and domicile is Kuwait <orig>الكويت</orig>. The partners may decide to transfer the head office to any other location in Kuwait <orig>الكويت</orig> and open branches and agencies for the company inside and outside Kuwait <orig>الكويت</orig>. This head office is considered the legal domicile of the company, which is relied upon for directing correspondence and judicial notices to the company and for registering its data in the Commercial Register <orig>السجل التجاري</orig>. No change to this head office shall be recognized until it is registered in the Commercial Register <orig>السجل التجاري</orig>.
Company Duration

Article (3)
The specified duration for the company's contract is 30 years, commencing from the date of the company's contract registration. This period may be extended before its expiry by a resolution issued by the Ordinary General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة العادية</orig> with the majority of partners holding more than half of the capital shares. If no extension resolution is issued and the company continues its activities, the company's duration shall automatically be extended each time for a period similar to that agreed upon in the contract and under the same conditions.
A partner who does not wish to remain in the company after its term expires shall have their rights determined in accordance with Article "11" of Companies Law No. 1 of 2016 <orig>قانون الشركات رقم 1 لسنة 2016</orig>, as amended by Law No. 15 of 2017 <orig>القانون رقم 15 لسنة 2017</orig>, and in accordance with the principles and controls stipulated in the executive regulations for the valuation of in-kind shares.
Company Purpose

Article (4)
Without prejudice to Companies Law No. 1 of 2016 <orig>قانون الشركات رقم 1 لسنة 2016</orig> and its executive regulations, and the provisions of Law No. 116 of 2013 <orig>القانون رقم 116 لسنة 2013</orig> concerning the encouragement of direct investment in the State of Kuwait <orig>دولة الكويت</orig> and its executive regulations, the purposes for which the company was established are:
1- Establishing renewable and alternative energy generation stations.
2- Operating renewable and alternative energy generation stations.
3- Technical consultations.
The company is prohibited from engaging in any of the activities stipulated in Cabinet Resolution No. 75 of 2015 <orig>قرار مجلس الوزراء رقم 75 لسنة 2015</orig> regarding restricting a list of direct investments not subject to the provisions of Law No. 116 of 2013 <orig>القانون رقم 116 لسنة 2013</orig>.
Company Capital

Article (5)
The company's capital is set at an amount of 100,000 Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>ديناراً كويتياً</orig> "only one hundred thousand Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig>" - divided into equal shares, each share valued at one hundred Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig>, non-divisible. If there are multiple owners of a single share, they must choose one person from among themselves to represent them before the company.
It consists of a total of 1000 shares, of which 1000 are cash shares, with the value of each cash share being 100 Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig>, distributed among the partners as follows:

Reserves

Article (6)
Annually, by a resolution of the Ordinary General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة العادية</orig> of the company and based on the proposal of the company's manager, a percentage of no less than ten percent of the net revenues shall be deducted to form a mandatory reserve for the company. This deduction may be suspended if the mandatory reserve exceeds half of the company's capital.

Each partner shall have the right to inspect the company's accounts, all its documents, records, and ledgers at the company's headquarters. Any decision violating this shall be null and void.

### The Company's Financial Year

### Article (14)
The company's financial year begins on the first of January of each year and ends on the last of December of the same year. The first financial year is an exception, starting from the date of the company's registration in the Commercial Register <orig>السجل التجاري</orig> and ending on the last of December of the following year.
In the event that the accuracy of the information contained in the inspection request is not proven, the manager shall submit a request to the Ministry of Commerce <orig>وزارة التجارة</orig> to publish the report's findings in two daily newspapers at the expense of the inspection applicants and on the company's website, without prejudice to their liability for compensation if applicable.

### The Company's General Assembly

### Article (15)
The company shall have a General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة</orig> composed of all partners, which shall convene upon the invitation of the company's manager.
The manager may call the General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة</orig> to a meeting at any time, and must call it to a meeting upon a request submitted to him by the auditor or a number of partners owning no less than a quarter of the company's capital. The Ministry of Commerce and Industry <orig>وزارة التجارة والصناعة</orig> may also call the General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة</orig> to a meeting and attend it at any time in cases where the manager is required to call it to a meeting but fails to do so.
The invitation to attend the General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة</orig> meeting, including the agenda, time, and place of the meeting, shall be sent by one of the following methods:
1. Registered letters sent to all partners at least two weeks before the scheduled date of the meeting.
2. Announcement, which must be made twice, with the second announcement taking place at least seven days after the date of publication of the first announcement and at least seven days before the meeting.
3. Hand delivery of the invitation to the partners or their legal representatives at least one day before the meeting, with an endorsement on a copy of the invitation confirming receipt.
4. Any method specified in the Executive Regulations <orig>اللائحة التنفيذية</orig> of Law No. 1 of 2016, as amended by Law No. 15 of 2017.

### Article (16)
Each partner has the right to attend the General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة</orig> meeting in person, or through a proxy who is not a member of the Supervisory Board <orig>مجلس الرقابة</orig> or the company's manager, by virtue of a power of attorney or authorization issued by the partner himself. Each partner shall have a number of votes equivalent to the number of shares they own in the company.

### Ordinary General Assembly

### Article (17)
The Ordinary General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة العادية</orig> meeting shall not be valid unless attended by a number of partners owning more than half of the capital. Decisions shall not be valid except by a majority of the shares represented at the meeting ("a larger majority may be stipulated"). If this quorum is not met at the first meeting, the same assembly shall be called within ten days following the first meeting with the same agenda. This meeting shall be valid regardless of the number of shares represented therein, and in this case, decisions shall be issued by a majority of the shares represented at the meeting. The company's manager shall not have the right to vote on decisions related to his discharge from liability.

### Article (18)
The company's manager must call the Ordinary General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة العادية</orig> to convene its annual meeting within three months of the end of the financial year. The agenda for the General Assembly's <orig>الجمعية العامة</orig> annual meeting shall include consideration and decision-making on the following matters:
1. The manager's report on the company's activities and financial position for the ended financial year, and the Supervisory Board's <orig>مجلس الرقابة</orig> report, if any.
2. The auditor's report on the company's financial statements.
3. The company's financial statements.
4. The manager's proposals regarding the distribution of returns.
5. Appointment or dismissal of the company's manager, or restriction of his authority [if not appointed in the company's articles of association].
6. Appointment and dismissal of the Supervisory Board <orig>مجلس الرقابة</orig>, if any.
7. Appointment of an auditor for the following financial year and determination of their fees.
8. Any other matters that any of the entities authorized to request a General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة</orig> meeting deem appropriate to include in the agenda.

### Extraordinary General Assembly

### Article (19)
The provisions related to the Ordinary General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة العادية</orig> shall apply to the company's Extraordinary General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة غير العادية</orig>, taking into account the provisions stipulated in the following two articles.

### Article (20)
The Extraordinary General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة غير العادية</orig> meeting shall not be valid unless attended by a number of partners owning three-quarters of the capital. Its decisions shall only be issued with the approval of partners owning three-quarters of the capital.

### Article (21)
The Extraordinary General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة غير العادية</orig> shall be competent in the following matters:
1. Amending the company's articles of association.
2. Dissolution and liquidation of the company.
3. Merger, transformation, or division of the company.
4. Increasing or decreasing the company's capital.
5. Dismissal of the company's manager, or restriction of his authority if he was appointed in the company's articles of association.
Subject to the provisions of merger, transformation, and division, the decisions of the Extraordinary General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة غير العادية</orig> shall be implemented by registering them in the Commercial Register <orig>السجل التجاري</orig>, without the need for them to be formalized in an official document.

### Article (22)
If the company's losses reach three-quarters of its capital, the manager must present to the Extraordinary General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة غير العادية</orig> the matter of covering the capital or dissolving the company, and taking other appropriate measures.
If the manager neglects to invite the partners or if the partners are unable to reach a decision on the matter, the manager or the partners – as the case may be – shall be jointly and severally liable for the company's obligations arising from their negligence.

### Dissolution and Liquidation of the Company

### Article (23)
The company shall be dissolved for one of the reasons stipulated in Companies Law No. 1 of 2016, as amended by Law No. 15 of 2017.
The dissolution of the company must be publicized, and it shall not be enforceable against third parties except from the date of publication. The company's manager must follow up on the implementation of this procedure.

### Article (24)
The liquidation of the company's assets upon its dissolution for any reason shall be carried out in accordance with the provisions contained in Companies Law No. 1 of 2016 and its Executive Regulations <orig>اللائحة التنفيذية</orig>, as amended by Law No. 15 of 2017.

### Article (25)
Unless otherwise stated in this contract, it shall be subject to the provisions of Companies Law No. 1 of 2016 and its Executive Regulations <orig>اللائحة التنفيذية</orig>, as amended by Law No. 15 of 2017.

### Article (26)
An original copy of this contract shall be kept at the company's main office and on its website.
An original copy of this contract shall also be kept in the company's file with the competent department at the Ministry of Commerce and Industry <orig>وزارة التجارة والصناعة</orig>, and the Kuwait Direct Investment Promotion Authority <orig>هيئة تشجيع الاستثمار المباشر</orig>.
An original copy of this contract shall also be kept in the company's file with the Ministry of Justice <orig>وزارة العدل</orig>.
Any person wishing to obtain a true copy must request it from the company for a fee determined by the company's management.
